content.name: Flame Lance
content.flavor: It's on the rack next to ice lance, acid lance, and English muffin lance.
content.text: Deal $8 damage to a minion.

content.name: Effigy
content.flavor: Burning man, brah.
content.text: Secret: When a friendly minion dies, summon a random minion with the same Cost.

content.name: Fallen Hero
content.flavor: And he can't get up.
content.text: Your Hero Power deals 1 extra damage.

content.name: Arcane Blast
content.flavor: Now with 100% more blast!
content.text: Deal $2 damage to a minion. This spell gets double bonus from Spell Damage.

content.name: Polymorph: Boar
content.flavor: It's always Huffer.
content.text: Transform a minion into a 4/2 Boar with Charge.

content.name: Dalaran Aspirant
content.flavor: Is he aspiring or inspiring?  Make up your mind!
content.text: Inspire: Gain Spell Damage +1.

content.name: Spellslinger
content.flavor: Does he sling spells, or do his spells linger about.  Who can say?
content.text: Battlecry: Add a random spell to each player's hand.

content.name: Coldarra Drake
content.flavor: The Grand Tournament has a 'No dragons allowed' policy, but it's rarely enforced.
content.text: You can use your Hero Power any number of times.

content.name: Rhonin
content.flavor: A masterless shamurai.
content.text: Deathrattle: Add 3 copies of Arcane Missiles to your hand.

content.name: Ram Wrangler
content.flavor: Not getting trampled is really the trick here.
content.text: Battlecry: If you have a Beast, summon a random Beast.

content.name: Holy Champion
content.flavor: She really likes seeing people get better.  That's why she hurts them in the first place.
content.text: Whenever a character is healed, gain +2 Attack.

content.name: Spawn of Shadows
content.flavor: What did you expect to happen?  He's a Spawn.  Of Shadows.
content.text: Inspire: Deal 4 damage to each hero.

content.name: Power Word: Glory
content.flavor: The promise of glory is a powerful tool to get minions to do your bidding.  Only slightly less powerful than the promise of an ice cream bar!
content.text: Choose a minion. Whenever it attacks, restore 4 Health to your hero.

content.name: Shadowfiend
content.flavor: Hopes to be promoted to 'Shadowfriend' someday.
content.text: Whenever you draw a card, reduce its Cost by (1).

content.name: Convert
content.flavor: 'Are you interested in... HEALTH benefits?!'
content.text: Put a copy of an enemy minion into your hand.

content.name: Confuse
content.flavor: This minion is really powerful!
content.text: Swap the Attack and Health of all minions.

content.name: Twilight Guardian
content.flavor: A result of magical experiments carried out by the Black Dragonflight, it's not his fault that he's a vicious killer.
content.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, gain +1 Attack and Taunt.

content.name: Confessor Paletress
content.flavor: She sees into your past and makes you face your fears.  Most common fear:  Getting Majordomo out of Sneed's Old Shredder.
content.text: Inspire: Summon a random Legendary minion.

content.name: Dreadsteed
content.flavor: Crescendo himself summoned this steed, riding it to victory in the Grand Tournament.  Wherever he rides, an army of riders ride behind him, supporting the legendary champion.
content.text: Deathrattle: At the end  of the turn, summon a Dreadsteed.

content.name: Fearsome Doomguard
content.flavor: They were originally called Cuddleguards, but they were not inspiring the proper amount of fear.

content.name: Tiny Knight of Evil
content.flavor: 'No, no, no. I asked for a tiny JESTER of evil.'
content.text: Whenever you discard a card, gain +1/+1.

content.name: Fist of Jaraxxus
content.flavor: * Not actually Jaraxxus' fist.
content.text: When you play or discard this, deal $4 damage to a random enemy.

content.name: Void Crusher
content.flavor: We like to call him 'Wesley'.
content.text: Inspire: Destroy a random minion for each player.

content.name: Demonfuse
content.flavor: Very dangerous when attached to a demonbomb.
content.text: Give a Demon +3/+3. Give your opponent a Mana Crystal.

content.name: Dark Bargain
content.flavor: A prime example of lose-lose negotiating.
content.text: Destroy 2 random enemy minions. Discard 2 random cards.

content.name: Wrathguard
content.flavor: After playing against 5 Annoy-O-Trons, any normal guard will become a Wrathguard.
content.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, also deal that amount to your hero.

content.name: Wilfred Fizzlebang
content.flavor: He can summon anything, even a FEARSOME DOOMGUARD*. *He's pretty sure this is going to work out.
content.text: Cards you draw from your Hero Power cost (0).

content.name: Shado-Pan Rider
content.flavor: He needed a break after that business in the Vale of Eternal Blossoms. Naturally, he chose to spend his vacation in an icy snowscape killing monsters.
content.text: Combo: Gain +3 Attack.

content.name: Buccaneer
content.flavor: The best part of buccaneering is the pants.
content.text: Whenever you equip a weapon, give it +1 Attack.

content.name: Undercity Valiant
content.flavor: Almost went to play for Stormwind before signing with Undercity.
content.text: Combo: Deal 1 damage.

content.name: Cutpurse
content.flavor: He has a giant collection of purses now.  One for every outfit!
content.text: Whenever this minion attacks a hero, add the Coin to your hand.

content.name: Shady Dealer
content.flavor: I have great deal for you... for 4 damage to your face!
content.text: Battlecry: If you have a Pirate, gain +1/+1.

content.name: Burgle
content.flavor: Yoink!
content.text: Add 2 random class cards to your hand (from your opponent's class).

content.name: Poisoned Blade
content.flavor: How much more poisoned can a blade get?  The answer is a lot.  A lot more poisoned.
content.text: Your Hero Power gives this weapon +1 Attack instead of replacing it.

content.name: Beneath the Grounds
content.flavor: Can you hold these eggs for just a second?  I promise they're not full of giant enraged undead spider things.
content.text: Shuffle 3 Ambushes into your opponent's deck. When drawn, you summon a 4/4 Nerubian.

content.name: Anub'arak
content.flavor: Was actually a pretty nice guy before, you know, the whole Lich King thing.
content.text: Deathrattle: Return this to your hand and summon a 4/4 Nerubian.

content.name: Living Roots
content.flavor: 2 out of 2 saplings recommend that you summon the saplings.
content.text: Choose One - Deal $2 damage; or Summon two 1/1 Saplings.

content.name: Darnassus Aspirant
content.flavor: She loves mana crystals, she hates mana crystals.   So fickle!
content.text: Battlecry: Gain an empty Mana Crystal. Deathrattle: Lose a Mana Crystal.

content.name: Savage Combatant
content.flavor: Maybe if you whistle a tune it will soothe him.  Yeah...  Try that.
content.text: Inspire: Give your hero +2 Attack this turn.

content.name: Wildwalker
content.flavor: She was born to be something.  She is just not quite sure what yet...
content.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly Beast +3 Health.

content.name: Knight of the Wild
content.flavor: He gets a discount on the tournament entry fee because he is his own horse.
content.text: Whenever you summon a Beast, reduce the Cost of this card by (1).

content.name: Druid of the Saber
content.flavor: That's saberTEETH, not like curved pirate blades.  That's a different kind of druid.  Druid of the Curved Pirate Blades.
content.text: Choose One - Transform into a 2/1 with Charge; or a 3/2 with Stealth.

content.name: Astral Communion
content.flavor: Hey!  Moon!  Can I have some mana crystals?
content.text: Gain 10 Mana Crystals. Discard your hand.

content.name: Mulch
content.flavor: Is this a noun or a verb?  We will never know.
content.text: Destroy a minion. Add a random minion to your opponent's hand.

content.name: Aviana
content.flavor: Call her 'Tweety'.  She'll find it real funny.  I PROMISE.
content.text: Your minions cost (1).

content.name: Tuskarr Totemic
content.flavor: Turns out the tuskarr aren't real choosy about their totems.
content.text: Battlecry: Summon a random basic Totem.

content.name: Draenei Totemcarver
content.flavor: It's nice to find a real craftsman in this day and age of mass-produced totems.
content.text: Battlecry: Gain +1/+1 for each friendly Totem.

content.name: Healing Wave
content.flavor: Favored by shaman who study the art of restoration and healing, this spell would feel smug, if it had feelings.
content.text: Restore #7 Health. Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, Restore #14 instead.

content.name: Thunder Bluff Valiant
content.flavor: Allowing totems to attack is not cheating.  I mean, there isn't anything in the rule books about it.
content.text: Inspire: Give your Totems +2 Attack.

content.name: Charged Hammer
content.flavor: You can only pick it up if you are worthy.
content.text: Deathrattle: Your Hero Power becomes 'Deal 2 damage.'

content.name: Elemental Destruction
content.flavor: I'm not a shaman or anything, but isn't Elemental Destruction the opposite of what they want to do?
content.text: Deal $4-$5 damage to all minions. Overload: (5)

content.name: Totem Golem
content.flavor: What happens when you glue a buncha totems together.
content.text: Overload: (1)

content.name: Ancestral Knowledge
content.flavor: MOMMMMMYYYYYYYYY!!!
content.text: Draw 2 cards. Overload: (2)

content.name: The Mistcaller
content.flavor: Calling the mist doesn't sound all that great.  'Ooooh, it is slightly damp now!'
content.text: Battlecry: Give all minions in your hand and deck +1/+1.

content.name: Flash Heal
content.flavor: Flash!  Ahhhhhhh~
content.text: Restore #5 Health.

content.name: Powershot
content.flavor: pow POW pow
content.text: Deal $2 damage to a minion and the minions next to it.

content.name: Stablemaster
content.flavor: Takes way better care of her pets than her brother, Unstablemaster.
content.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly Beast Immune this turn.

content.name: King's Elekk
content.flavor: Elekk jousting is AWESOME.
content.text: Battlecry: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, draw it.

content.name: Brave Archer
content.flavor: This is a 'bearly' concealed reference.
content.text: Inspire: If your hand is empty, deal 2 damage to the enemy hero.

content.name: Bear Trap
content.flavor: You'll never guess what's in that conveniently bear-sized, bear-smelling box.
content.text: Secret: After your hero is attacked, summon a 3/3 Bear with Taunt.

content.name: Lock and Load
content.flavor: Rexxar narrowed his eyes, grabbed his machine gun, and said: 'It's go time.  Lock and load.' This card pays homage to that special moment.
content.text: Each time you cast a spell this turn, add a random Hunter card to your hand.

content.name: Ball of Spiders
content.flavor: 'THEY'RE EVERYWHERE GET THEM OFF!!!' - Everyone
content.text: Summon three 1/1 Webspinners.

content.name: Acidmaw
content.flavor: With the help of his trusty sidekick Dreadscale, the giant jormungar Acidmaw is ready to face any knight!
content.text: Whenever another minion takes damage, destroy it.

content.name: Dreadscale
content.flavor: Let's be clear about this:  ACIDMAW is the sidekick.
content.text: At the end of your turn, deal 1 damage to all other minions.

content.name: Bash
content.flavor: You might think bashing doesn't take a lot of practice.  It doesn't.
content.text: Deal $3 damage. Gain 3 Armor.

content.name: King's Defender
content.flavor: 'King's Attacker' is a shield.  Funny, huh?
content.text: Battlecry: If you have a minion with Taunt, gain +1 Durability.

content.name: Orgrimmar Aspirant
content.flavor: 'Four out of three orcs struggle with math.' - Angry Zurge
content.text: Inspire: Give your weapon +1 Attack.

content.name: Magnataur Alpha
content.flavor: Playing him also gets you into the Magnataur Beta.
content.text: Also damages the minions next to whomever he attacks.

content.name: Bolster
content.flavor: The best offense is a good defense.
content.text: Give your Taunt minions +2/+2.

content.name: Sparring Partner
content.flavor: Come at me, bro.
content.text: Taunt Battlecry: Give a minion Taunt.

content.name: Skycap'n Kragg
content.flavor: What's more boss than riding a parrot with a jawbone for a shoulderpad while wielding a giant hook-lance-thing and wearing a pirate hat?  NOTHING.
content.text: Charrrrrge Costs (1) less for each friendly Pirate.

content.name: Alexstrasza's Champion
content.flavor: 'Put more spikes on her.  No, more spikes.  What part of 'more spikes' do you not understand?  MORE SPIKES!' - Alexstrasza
content.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, gain +1 Attack and Charge.

content.name: Varian Wrynn
content.flavor: Leader of the Alliance!  Father of Anduin!  Also he likes to play Arena, and he averages 12 wins.
content.text: Battlecry: Draw 3 cards. Put any minions you drew directly into the battlefield.

content.name: Competitive Spirit
content.flavor: Competition can be an inspiration to improve oneself.  Or kill all the competitors.
content.text: Secret: When your turn starts, give your minions +1/+1.

content.name: Seal of Champions
content.flavor: 'Arf! Arf! Arf!' - Seal of Champions
content.text: Give a minion +3 Attack and Divine Shield.

content.name: Warhorse Trainer
content.flavor: He doesn't even get Sundays off.  Every day he's hostling.
content.text: Your Silver Hand Recruits have +1 Attack.

content.name: Murloc Knight
content.flavor: Hee hee!  Look at his cute little feet.
content.text: Inspire: Summon a random Murloc.

content.name: Argent Lance
content.flavor: The stripes make it look like a candy cane, but we recommend against licking it.
content.text: Battlecry: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, +1 Durability.

content.name: Enter the Coliseum
content.flavor: You have to get past the vendors first.  So many are lost to shopping...
content.text: Destroy all minions except each player's highest Attack minion.

content.name: Mysterious Challenger
content.flavor: He may sound surly and antisocial, but he's actually just really shy.
content.text: Battlecry: Put one of each Secret from your deck into the battlefield.

content.name: Garrison Commander
content.flavor: He'll never admit it, but he pushes you hard because he really cares about you.
content.text: You can use your Hero Power twice a turn.

content.name: Eadric the Pure
content.flavor: Nobody rocks a monocle like Eadric.
content.text: Battlecry: Change all enemy minions' Attack to 1.

content.name: Lowly Squire
content.flavor: But not the lowliest!
content.text: Inspire: Gain +1 Attack.

content.name: Dragonhawk Rider
content.flavor: Check it out.  You can do barrel rolls on this thing.
content.text: Inspire: Gain Windfury this turn.

content.name: Lance Carrier
content.flavor: Lance Carrier is an obscure entry level position in orcish armies.  A mystery, since orcs don't generally use lances.
content.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly minion +2 Attack.

content.name: Maiden of the Lake
content.flavor: Not a good basis for a system of government.
content.text: Your Hero Power costs (1).

content.name: Saboteur
content.flavor: Listen all y'all it's a saboteur!
content.text: Battlecry: Your opponent's Hero Power costs (5) more next turn.

content.name: Argent Horserider
content.flavor: His horse's name is Betsy.
content.text: Charge Divine Shield

content.name: Mogor's Champion
content.flavor: This champion has learned from the best.  Except for his target selection.
content.text: 50% chance to attack the wrong enemy.

content.name: Boneguard Lieutenant
content.flavor: Underneath all that impressive armor, he's just skin and bones.  Okay, maybe just bones.
content.text: Inspire: Gain +1 Health.

content.name: Mukla's Champion
content.flavor: An elegant gorilla, for a more civilized age.
content.text: Inspire: Give your other minions +1/+1.

content.name: Tournament Medic
content.flavor: The medic tournament is less entertaining than the Grand Tournament.
content.text: Inspire: Restore 2 Health to your hero.

content.name: Ice Rager
content.flavor: He's a lot cooler than Magma Rager.

content.name: Frigid Snobold
content.flavor: Ironically, the natural enemy of the snobold is THE CANDLE.
content.text: Spell Damage +1

content.name: Flame Juggler
content.flavor: At first he liked juggling chain saws, but then he thought, 'Flames are better!  Because FIRE!'
content.text: Battlecry: Deal 1 damage to a random enemy.

content.name: Silent Knight
content.flavor: He used to be a librarian.  Old habits die hard.
content.text: Stealth Divine Shield

content.name: Clockwork Knight
content.flavor: It takes a lot to wind him up.
content.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly Mech +1/+1.

content.name: Tournament Attendee
content.flavor: He was so excited to get season tickets to this year's Grand Tournament.  He normally doesn't get them at first and has to buy them from Ogre scalpers.
content.text: Taunt

content.name: Sideshow Spelleater
content.flavor: Hey!  Let me try that...
content.text: Battlecry: Copy your opponent's Hero Power.

content.name: Kodorider
content.flavor: Someone called her a Rhinorider, and she's NOT HAPPY.
content.text: Inspire: Summon a 3/5 War Kodo.

content.name: Silver Hand Regent
content.flavor: The Silver Hand is the best paladin organization.  The Argent Crusaders are super jealous.
content.text: Inspire: Summon a 1/1 Silver Hand Recruit.

content.name: Pit Fighter
content.flavor: What did the pits ever do to you?

content.name: Captured Jormungar
content.flavor: You can keep him, but you have to promise to feed him and clean out his tank every day!

content.name: North Sea Kraken
content.flavor: You have no idea how tired this guy is of being released.
content.text: Battlecry: Deal 4 damage.

content.name: Tuskarr Jouster
content.flavor: Just could not be talked out of using his turtle for the joust...
content.text: Battlecry: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, restore 7 Health to your hero.

content.name: Injured Kvaldir
content.flavor: Don't worry.  With a little skin cream he's going to clear right up.
content.text: Battlecry: Deal 3 damage to this minion.

content.name: Light's Champion
content.flavor: When there's something strange (say, a gibbering demon) in your neighborhood, who are you going to call?
content.text: Battlecry: Silence a Demon.

content.name: Armored Warhorse
content.flavor: Yep.  It's a horse... wearing armor... going to war.
content.text: Battlecry: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, gain Charge.

content.name: Argent Watchman
content.flavor: Who argent watches the Argent Watchman?
content.text: Can't attack. Inspire: Can attack as normal this turn.

content.name: Coliseum Manager
content.flavor: Meets monthly with the gladiators to discuss career goals.
content.text: Inspire: Return this minion to your hand.

content.name: Refreshment Vendor
content.flavor: Menu:  Funnel cakes, carrots, popcorn, jormungar steaks.  It's hard serving a diverse clientele.
content.text: Battlecry: Restore 4 Health to each hero.

content.name: Master Jouster
content.flavor: Needs just a few more ratings points to become Grandmaster Jouster.
content.text: Battlecry: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, gain Taunt and Divine Shield.

content.name: Recruiter
content.flavor: Join the Argent Crusade!  We have attractive tabards and you get to carry really nice swords!
content.text: Inspire: Add a 2/2 Squire to your hand.

content.name: Evil Heckler
content.flavor: To be honest, heckling is not the most effective form of evil.
content.text: Taunt

content.name: Fencing Coach
content.flavor: Good fencers make good neighbors, right?
content.text: Battlecry: The next time you use your Hero Power, it costs (2) less.

content.name: Wyrmrest Agent
content.flavor: Keeping tabs on the Grand Tournament is priority #1 for the five mighty Dragonflights!
content.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, gain +1 Attack and Taunt.

content.name: Master of Ceremonies
content.flavor: Goes by 'MC ElfyElf'.
content.text: Battlecry: If you have a minion with Spell Damage, gain +2/+2.

content.name: Grand Crusader
content.flavor: A veteran of a number of crusades, she is a force for light and goodness.  Her latest crusade is against goblin telemarketers.
content.text: Battlecry: Add a random Paladin card to your hand.

content.name: Kvaldir Raider
content.flavor: Coming soon... to a tuskarr village near you!
content.text: Inspire: Gain +2/+2.

content.name: Frost Giant
content.flavor: Don't ask him about the beard.  JUST DON'T.
content.text: Costs (1) less for each time you used your Hero Power this game.

content.name: Crowd Favorite
content.flavor: The crowd ALWAYS yells lethal.
content.text: Whenever you play a card with Battlecry, gain +1/+1.

content.name: Gormok the Impaler
content.flavor: Gormok has been giving impaling lessons in a small tent near the tournament grounds.  For only 25g you too could learn the fine art of impaling!
content.text: Battlecry: If you have at least 4 other minions, deal 4 damage.

content.name: Chillmaw
content.flavor: Chillmaw keeps trying to ruin the Grand Tournament, and she would've done it too, if it weren't for those dang kids!
content.text: Taunt Deathrattle: If you're holding a Dragon, deal 3 damage to all minions.

content.name: Bolf Ramshield
content.flavor: Bolf keeps coming in 2nd at the Grand Tournament.  It might be his year this year, if Lebron doesn't enter.
content.text: Whenever your hero takes damage, this minion takes it instead.

content.name: Icehowl
content.flavor: This massive yeti just closes his eyes and charges at the nearest target.  The nearest Target is a couple blocks away and has sick deals on skateboards.
content.text: Charge Can't attack heroes.

content.name: Nexus-Champion Saraad
content.flavor: The ethereals have their own jousting tournament, and Saraad is the reigning champion.  Also he won the ethereal hot dog eating contest.
content.text: Inspire: Add a random spell to your hand.

content.name: The Skeleton Knight
content.flavor: Apparently it really was just a flesh wound.
content.text: Deathrattle: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, return this to your hand.

content.name: Fjola Lightbane
content.flavor: LOVES being called 'the wonder twins'.
content.text: Whenever you target this minion with a spell, gain Divine Shield.

content.name: Sea Reaver
content.flavor: A little better than Sea Minus Reaver.
content.text: When you draw this, deal 1 damage to your minions.

content.name: Eydis Darkbane
content.flavor: HATES being called 'the wonder twins'.
content.text: Whenever you target this minion with a spell, deal 3 damage to a random enemy.

content.name: Justicar Trueheart
content.flavor: It's like putting racing stripes and a giant spoiler on your hero power.
content.text: Battlecry: Replace your starting Hero Power with a better one.

content.name: Gadgetzan Jouster
content.flavor: It's not HER fault you didn't put a spinning saw blade on your horse.
content.text: Battlecry: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, gain +1/+1.

content.name: Solemn Vigil
content.flavor: Each year, folk gather in front of Blackrock Mountain to mourn those who were mind-controlled into the lava.
content.howToEarn: Unlocked in Hidden Laboratory, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
content.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in Hidden Laboratory, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
content.text: Draw 2 cards. Costs (1) less for each minion that died this turn.

content.name: Flamewaker
content.flavor: Flamewakers HATE being confused for Flamewalkers. They just wake up fire, they don’t walk on it. Walking on fire is CRAZY.
content.howToEarn: Unlocked in Blackwing Lair, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
content.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in Blackwing Lair, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
content.text: After you cast a spell, deal 2 damage randomly split among all enemies.

content.name: Dragon's Breath
content.flavor: Dragons breathe fire, sure, but did you know they can also breathe Cotton Candy?  It's harder to give them a reason to do that, though.
content.howToEarn: Unlocked in Blackrock Depths, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
content.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in Blackrock Depths, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
content.text: Deal $4 damage. Costs (1) less for each minion that died this turn.

content.name: Twilight Whelp
content.flavor: The twilight whelps are basically magic-vampires. Despite this, they are not a reference to any popular series of novels.
content.howToEarn: Unlocked in Blackrock Spire, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
content.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in Blackrock Spire, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
content.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, gain +2 Health.

content.name: Demonwrath
content.flavor: Demons are not angry most of the time. You have to play this card in order to really bring it out of them.
content.howToEarn: Unlocked in Blackwing Lair, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
content.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in Blackwing Lair, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
content.text: Deal $2 damage to all minions except Demons.

content.name: Imp Gang Boss
content.flavor: His imp gang likes to sneak into Stormwind to spraypaint 'Ragnaros Rulez' on the Mage Tower.
content.howToEarn: Unlocked in Molten Core, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
content.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in Molten Core, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
content.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, summon a 1/1 Imp.

content.name: Gang Up
content.flavor: If you are thinking about visiting Moonbrook, you better roll deep.
content.howToEarn: Unlocked in Blackrock Depths, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
content.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in Blackrock Depths, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
content.text: Choose a minion. Shuffle 3 copies of it into your deck.

content.name: Dark Iron Skulker
content.flavor: He loves skulking. He skulks after hours just for the joy of it, but his friends are pretty worried he'll get burnt out.
content.howToEarn: Unlocked in Blackwing Lair, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
content.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in Blackwing Lair, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
content.text: Battlecry: Deal 2 damage to all undamaged enemy minions.

content.name: Volcanic Lumberer
content.flavor: The roots, the roots, the roots is on fire!
content.howToEarn: Unlocked in Blackrock Spire, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
content.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in Blackrock Spire, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
content.text: Taunt Costs (1) less for each minion that died this turn.

content.name: Druid of the Flame
content.flavor: Druids who fought too long in Northrend were easily seduced by Ragnaros; a mug of hot chocolate was generally all it took.
content.howToEarn: Unlocked in Molten Core, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
content.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in Molten Core, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.

content.name: Jade Blossom

content.flavor: Meditating under a jade blossom is said to grant you wisdom, unless you have a pollen allergy.
content.text: Summon a{1} {0} Jade Golem. Gain an empty Mana Crystal.

content.name: Jade Spirit
content.collectionText: Battlecry: Summon a Jade Golem.
content.flavor: 'He's so cute!  I just want to squeeze him, then use him for Jade Golem parts!' - Aya Blackpaw
content.text: Battlecry: Summon a{1} {0} Jade Golem.

content.name: Sleep with the Fishes
content.flavor: If you're sleeping with the fishes, we highly suggest not bringing an electric blanket.
content.text: Deal $3 damage to all damaged minions.

content.name: Krul the Unshackled
content.flavor: Spicklefizz pondered his life choices as he looked at the chain around his neck. 'Become a warlock,' they said. 'You get to enslave demons,' they said.
content.text: Battlecry: If your deck has no duplicates, summon all  Demons from your hand.

content.name: Abyssal Enforcer
content.flavor: The Kabal print this on every package of illicit Mana Crystals: WARNING - DO NOT PUT WITHIN REACH OF ABYSSALS. THIS IS NOT APPROVED FOR USE BY FLAMING DEMONS OF ANY KIND.
content.text: Battlecry: Deal 3 damage to all other characters.

content.name: Stolen Goods
content.flavor: It fell off a kodo, I promise!

content.flavor: 'Listen, I can cut you in on a little of this premium mana, but you can't tell my boss.'

content.name: Shaku, the Collector
content.flavor: Aya even staged an intervention once, but Shaku still insists that he is not a hoarder.
content.text: Stealth. Whenever this attacks, add a random card to your hand (from your opponent's class).

content.name: Dirty Rat
content.flavor: It's not his fault…  Someone keeps stealing his soap!
content.text: Taunt Battlecry: Your opponent summons a random minion from their hand.

content.name: Getaway Kodo
content.flavor: Get to da Kodo! Now!
content.text: Secret: When a friendly minion dies, return it to your hand.

content.name: Wrathion
content.flavor: Wrathion, son of Deathwing, is a dragon.  Why isn't he tagged as a dragon, you ask?  WHAT, ARE YOU TRYING TO BLOW HIS COVER??
content.text: Taunt. Battlecry: Draw cards until you draw one that isn't a Dragon.

content.name: Auctionmaster Beardo
content.flavor: Gadgetzan has always run an under-the-table auction house, and business has been PRETTY good for Beardo since the population explosion.  And since the explosion that destroyed the competing auction houses in the city.
content.text: After you cast a spell, refresh your Hero Power.

content.name: Genzo, the Shark
content.flavor: Infamous in the seedy underground card rooms of Gadgetzan, he got his nickname winning the coveted Shark Plushie in the city's first Hearthstone tournament.
content.text: Whenever this attacks, both players draw until they have 3 cards.

content.name: Tanaris Hogchopper
content.flavor: The Hogchoppers are well-known throughout Kalimdor for being a real, actual group.
content.text: Battlecry: If your opponent's hand is empty, gain Charge.

content.name: Leatherclad Hogleader
content.flavor: The Hogchoppers, the terrors of Tanaris, can always be found at one tavern or another in Gadgetzan, refueling for totally real and legit adventures that they go on.
content.text: Battlecry: If your opponent has 6 or more cards in hand, gain Charge.

content.name: Lunar Visions
content.flavor: The true mystery of lunar visions is how there is nothing to watch when there are so many channels.
content.text: Draw 2 cards. Minions drawn cost (2) less.

content.name: Wickerflame Burnbristle
content.flavor: Wickerflame spent years as a recruit for the Goons, never making the big-time because he always fired his chest-cannon too slowly.  'Hey,' he thought, 'maybe if I keep my beard lit on fire, I can do this faster.'  BOOM, promoted.
content.text: Divine Shield, Taunt, Lifesteal

content.howToEarnGolden: Unlocked at Mage Level 57.
content.text: Spell Damage +1

content.name: Ravenholdt Assassin
content.flavor: Just mail him a package with a name and 10,000 gold.  He'll take care of the rest.
content.text: Stealth

content.name: Lord of the Arena
content.flavor: He used to be a 2100+ rated arena player, but that was years ago and nobody can get him to shut up about it.
content.howToEarnGolden: Unlocked at Priest Level 59.
content.text: Taunt

content.name: Murloc Raider
content.flavor: Mrrraggglhlhghghlgh, mrgaaag blarrghlgaahahl mrgggg glhalhah a bghhll graggmgmg Garrosh mglhlhlh mrghlhlhl!!
content.howToEarnGolden: Unlocked at Priest Level 51.

content.name: Young Dragonhawk
content.flavor: They were the inspiration for the championship Taurenball team: The Dragonhawks.
content.text: Windfury

content.name: Stonetusk Boar
content.flavor: This card is boaring.
content.howToEarnGolden: Unlocked at Hunter Level 53.
content.text: Charge

content.name: Bloodfen Raptor
content.flavor: 'Kill 30 raptors.' - Hemet Nesingwary
content.howToEarnGolden: Unlocked at Hunter Level 57.

content.name: Bluegill Warrior
content.flavor: He just wants a hug.   A sloppy... slimy... hug.
content.howToEarnGolden: Unlocked at Paladin Level 53.
content.text: Charge

content.name: Sen'jin Shieldmasta
content.flavor: Sen'jin Villiage is nice, if you like trolls and dust.
content.howToEarnGolden: Unlocked at Rogue Level 59.
content.text: Taunt

content.name: Injured Blademaster
content.flavor: He claims it is an old war wound, but we think he just cut himself shaving.
content.text: Battlecry: Deal 4 damage to HIMSELF.

content.name: Chillwind Yeti
content.flavor: He always dreamed of coming down from the mountains and opening a noodle shop, but he never got the nerve.
content.howToEarnGolden: Unlocked at Warrior Level 55.

content.name: War Golem
content.flavor: Golems are not afraid, but for some reason they still run when you cast Fear on them.  Instinct, maybe?  A desire to blend in?
content.howToEarnGolden: Unlocked at Rogue Level 51.

content.name: Booty Bay Bodyguard
content.flavor: You can hire him... until someone offers him enough gold to turn on you.
content.howToEarnGolden: Unlocked at Shaman Level 55.
content.text: Taunt

content.name: Abusive Sergeant
content.flavor: ADD ME TO YOUR DECK, MAGGOT!
content.text: Battlecry: Give a minion +2 Attack this turn.

content.name: Elven Archer
content.flavor: Don't bother asking her out on a date.  She'll shoot you down.
content.howToEarnGolden: Unlocked at Druid Level 57.
content.text: Battlecry: Deal 1 damage.

content.name: Razorfen Hunter
content.flavor: Someone did mess with Tuskerr once.  ONCE.
content.howToEarnGolden: Unlocked at Hunter Level 55.
content.text: Battlecry: Summon a 1/1 Boar.

content.name: Ogre Magi
content.flavor: Training Ogres in the art of spellcasting is a questionable decision.
content.howToEarnGolden: Unlocked at Warlock Level 55.
content.text: Spell Damage +1

content.name: Boulderfist Ogre
content.flavor: 'ME HAVE GOOD STATS FOR THE COST'
content.howToEarnGolden: Unlocked at Warlock Level 51.

content.name: Core Hound
content.flavor: You don’t tame a Core Hound. You just train it to eat someone else before it eats you.
content.howToEarnGolden: Unlocked at Hunter Level 51.

content.name: Ironbeak Owl
content.flavor: Their wings are silent but their screech is... whatever the opposite of silent is.
content.text: Battlecry: Silence a minion.

content.name: Reckless Rocketeer
content.flavor: One Insane Rocketeer.   One Rocket full of Explosives.   Infinite Fun.
content.howToEarnGolden: Unlocked at Shaman Level 59.
content.text: Charge

content.name: Spiteful Smith
content.flavor: She'll craft you a sword, but you'll need to bring her 5 Steel Ingots, 3 Motes of Earth, and the scalp of her last customer.
content.text: Enrage: Your weapon has +2 Attack.

content.name: Stormwind Champion
content.flavor: When Deathwing assaulted the capital, this soldier was the only member of his squad to survive. Now he's all bitter and stuff.
content.howToEarnGolden: Unlocked at Paladin Level 59.
content.text: Your other minions have +1/+1.

content.name: Frostwolf Warlord
content.flavor: The Frostwolves are locked in combat with the Stormpike Expedition over control of Alterac Valley.  Every attempt at peace-talks has ended with Captain Galvangar killing the mediator.
content.howToEarnGolden: Unlocked at Shaman Level 53.
content.text: Battlecry: Gain +1/+1 for each other friendly minion on the battlefield.

content.name: Venture Co. Mercenary
content.flavor: No Job is too big.  No fee is too big.
content.text: Your minions cost (3) more.

content.name: Wisp
content.flavor: If you hit an Eredar Lord with enough Wisps, it will explode.   But why?

content.name: Ironbark Protector
content.flavor: I dare you to attack Darnassus.
content.howToEarn: Unlocked at Level 10.
content.howToEarnGolden: Unlocked at Level 49.
content.text: Taunt

content.name: Blade Flurry
content.flavor: 'Look, it's not just about waving daggers around really fast.  It's a lot more complicated than that.' - Shan, Rogue Trainer
content.text: Destroy your weapon and deal its damage to all enemy minions.

content.name: Shadow Word: Pain
content.flavor: A step up from a spell cast by many beginning acolytes: 'Shadow Word: Annoy'.
content.howToEarn: Unlocked at Level 1.
content.howToEarnGolden: Unlocked at Level 36.
content.text: Destroy a minion with 3 or less Attack.

content.name: Northshire Cleric
content.flavor: They help the downtrodden and distressed.  Also they sell cookies.
content.howToEarn: Unlocked at Level 1.
content.howToEarnGolden: Unlocked at Level 40.
content.text: Whenever a minion is healed, draw a card.

content.name: Divine Spirit
content.flavor: Double the trouble. Double the fun!
content.howToEarn: Unlocked at Level 2.
content.howToEarnGolden: Unlocked at Level 28.
content.text: Double a minion's Health.

content.name: Starving Buzzard
content.flavor: If you feed him, he loses his whole identity.
content.howToEarn: Unlocked at Level 4.
content.howToEarnGolden: Unlocked at Level 47.
content.text: Whenever you summon a Beast, draw a card.

content.name: Darkscale Healer
content.flavor: Healing is just something she does in her free time.  It's more of a hobby really.
content.howToEarnGolden: Unlocked at Priest Level 55.
content.text: Battlecry: Restore 2 Health to all friendly characters.

content.name: Houndmaster
content.flavor: 'Who let the dogs out?' he asks.  It's rhetorical.
content.howToEarn: Unlocked at Level 1.
content.howToEarnGolden: Unlocked at Level 28.
content.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly Beast +2/+2 and Taunt.

content.name: Timber Wolf
content.flavor: Other beasts totally dig hanging out with timber wolves.
content.howToEarn: Unlocked at Level 1.
content.howToEarnGolden: Unlocked at Level 23.
content.text: Your other Beasts have +1 Attack.

content.name: Tundra Rhino
content.flavor: Tundra rhinos are often mistaken for kodos.  Or am I mistaken?
content.howToEarn: Unlocked at Level 8.
content.howToEarnGolden: Unlocked at Level 43.
content.text: Your Beasts have Charge.

content.name: Multi-Shot
content.flavor: You see, it's all about throughput.
content.howToEarn: Unlocked at Level 1.
content.howToEarnGolden: Unlocked at Level 36.
content.text: Deal $3 damage to two random enemy minions.

content.name: Tracking
content.flavor: For the person who just cannot decide what card to put into a deck!
content.howToEarn: Unlocked at Level 1.
content.howToEarnGolden: Unlocked at Level 15.
content.text: Look at the top 3 cards of your deck. Draw one and discard the others.

content.name: Arcane Shot
content.flavor: Magi conjured arcane arrows to sell to hunters, until hunters learned just enough magic to do it themselves.  The resulting loss of jobs sent Stormwind into a minor recession.
content.howToEarn: Unlocked at Level 1.
content.howToEarnGolden: Unlocked at Level 32.
content.text: Deal $2 damage.

content.name: Gladiator's Longbow
content.flavor: The longbow allows shots to be fired from farther away and is useful for firing on particularly odorous targets.
content.text: Your hero is Immune while attacking.

content.name: Mind Blast
content.flavor: This spell blasts you directly in the MIND.
content.howToEarn: Unlocked at Level 1.
content.howToEarnGolden: Unlocked at Level 15.
content.text: Deal $5 damage to the enemy hero.

content.name: Lightwarden
content.flavor: She’s smaller than her sisters Mediumwarden and Heavywarden.
content.text: Whenever a character is healed, gain +2 Attack.

content.name: The Black Knight
content.flavor: He was sent by the Lich King to disrupt the Argent Tournament.   We can pretty much mark that a failure.
content.text: Battlecry: Destroy an enemy minion with Taunt.

content.name: Young Priestess
content.flavor: She can't wait to learn Power Word: Fortitude Rank 2.
content.text: At the end of your turn, give another random friendly minion +1 Health.

content.name: Big Game Hunter
content.flavor: Mere devilsaurs no longer excite him.  Soon he'll be trying to catch Onyxia with only a dull Krol Blade.
content.targetingArrowText: Destroy a minion with an Attack of 7 or more.
content.text: Battlecry: Destroy a minion with 7 or more Attack.

content.name: Alarm-o-Bot
content.flavor: WARNING.  WARNING.  WARNING.
content.text: At the start of your turn, swap this minion with a    random one in your hand.

content.name: Acolyte of Pain
content.flavor: He trained when he was younger to be an acolyte of joy, but things didn’t work out like he thought they would.
content.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, draw a card.

content.name: Argent Squire
content.flavor: 'I solemnly swear to uphold the Light, purge the world of darkness, and to eat only burritos.' - The Argent Dawn Oath
content.text: Divine Shield

content.name: Angry Chicken
content.flavor: There is no beast more frightening (or ridiculous) than a fully enraged chicken.
content.text: Enrage: +5 Attack.

content.name: Worgen Infiltrator
content.flavor: If you want to stop a worgen from infiltrating, just yell, 'No! Bad boy!'
content.text: Stealth

content.name: Voodoo Doctor
content.flavor: Voodoo is an oft-misunderstood art. But it is art.
content.howToEarnGolden: Unlocked at Rogue Level 55.
content.text: Battlecry: Restore 2 Health.

content.name: Bloodmage Thalnos
content.flavor: He's in charge of the Annual Scarlet Monastery Blood Drive!
content.text: Spell Damage +1 Deathrattle: Draw a card.

content.name: King Mukla
content.flavor: King Mukla wanders Jaguero Isle, searching for love.
content.text: Battlecry: Give your opponent 2 Bananas.

content.name: Novice Engineer
content.flavor: 'Half of this class will not graduate… since they'll have been turned to chickens.' - Tinkmaster Overspark, teaching Gizmos 101.
content.howToEarnGolden: Unlocked at Druid Level 59.
content.text: Battlecry: Draw a card.

content.name: Sylvanas Windrunner
content.flavor: Sylvanas was turned into the Banshee Queen by Arthas, but he probably should have just killed her because it just pissed her off.
content.text: Deathrattle: Take control of a random enemy minion.

content.name: Jungle Panther
content.flavor: Stranglethorn is a beautiful place to visit, but you wouldn't want to live there.
content.text: Stealth

content.name: Shattered Sun Cleric
content.flavor: They always have a spare flask of Sunwell Energy Drink™!
content.howToEarnGolden: Unlocked at Priest Level 53.
content.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly minion +1/+1.

content.name: Scarlet Crusader
content.flavor: Never wash your whites with a Scarlet Crusader.
content.text: Divine Shield

content.name: Thrallmar Farseer
content.flavor: He's stationed in the Hellfire Peninsula, but he's hoping for a reassignment closer to Orgrimmar, or really anywhere the ground is less on fire.
content.text: Windfury

content.name: Silvermoon Guardian
content.flavor: The first time they tried to guard Silvermoon against the scourge, it didn’t go so well…
content.text: Divine Shield

content.name: Dragonling Mechanic
content.flavor: She is still working on installing the rocket launcher add-on for Mr. Bitey.
content.howToEarnGolden: Unlocked at Mage Level 53.
content.text: Battlecry: Summon a 2/1 Mechanical Dragonling.

content.name: Stranglethorn Tiger
content.flavor: The wonderful thing about tigers is tigers are wonderful things!
content.text: Stealth

content.name: Leper Gnome
content.flavor: He really just wants to be your friend, but the constant rejection is starting to really get to him.
content.text: Deathrattle: Deal 2 damage to the enemy hero.

content.name: Sunwalker
content.flavor: She doesn’t ACTUALLY walk on the Sun.  It's just a name.  Don’t worry!
content.text: Taunt Divine Shield

content.name: Windfury Harpy
content.flavor: Harpies are not pleasant sounding.  That's the nicest I can put it.
content.text: Windfury

content.name: Twilight Drake
content.flavor: Twilight drakes feed on Mystical Energy.  And Tacos.
content.text: Battlecry: Gain +1 Health for each card in your hand.

content.name: Questing Adventurer
content.flavor: 'Does anyone have some extra Boar Pelts?'
content.text: Whenever you play a card, gain +1/+1.

content.name: Ancient Watcher
content.flavor: Why do its eyes seem to follow you as you walk by?
content.text: Can't attack.

content.name: Dark Iron Dwarf
content.flavor: Guardians of Dark Iron Ore.  Perhaps the most annoying ore, given where you have to forge it.
content.text: Battlecry: Give a minion +2 Attack this turn.

content.name: Spellbreaker
content.flavor: Spellbreakers can rip enchantments from magic-wielders.  The process is painless and can be performed on an outpatient basis.
content.text: Battlecry: Silence a minion.

content.name: Youthful Brewmaster
content.flavor: His youthful enthusiasm doesn’t always equal excellence in his brews.   Don’t drink the Mogu Stout!
content.targetingArrowText: Return a minion to your hand.
content.text: Battlecry: Return a friendly minion from the battlefield to your hand.

content.name: Coldlight Oracle
content.flavor: They can see the future.   In that future both players draw more cards.   Spoooky.
content.text: Battlecry: Each player draws 2 cards.

content.name: Mana Addict
content.flavor: She’s trying to kick the habit, but still takes some mana whenever she has a stressful day.
content.text: Whenever you cast a spell, gain +2 Attack this turn.

content.name: Ancient Brewmaster
content.flavor: Most pandaren say his brew tastes like yak.  But apparently that's a compliment.
content.targetingArrowText: Return a minion to your hand.
content.text: Battlecry: Return a friendly minion from the battlefield to your hand.

content.name: Sunfury Protector
content.flavor: She carries a shield, but only so she can give it to someone she can stand behind.
content.text: Battlecry: Give adjacent minions Taunt.

content.name: Crazed Alchemist
content.flavor: 'You'll love my new recipe!' he says... especially if you're not happy with your current number of limbs.
content.targetingArrowText: Swap Attack and Health of a minion.
content.text: Battlecry: Swap the Attack and Health of a minion.

content.name: Old Murk-Eye
content.flavor: He's a legend among murlocs.  'Mrghllghghllghg!', they say.
content.howToEarn: Unlocked when you have all the Murlocs from the Classic Set.
content.howToEarnGolden: Unlocked when you have all the Golden Murlocs from the Expert and Basic Sets.
content.text: Charge. Has +1 Attack for each other Murloc on the battlefield.

content.name: Acidic Swamp Ooze
content.flavor: Oozes love Flamenco.  Don't ask.
content.howToEarnGolden: Unlocked at Rogue Level 57.
content.text: Battlecry: Destroy your opponent's weapon.

content.name: Argent Commander
content.flavor: The Argent Dawn stands vigilant against the Scourge, as well as people who cut in line at coffee shops.
content.text: Charge Divine Shield

content.name: Pint-Sized Summoner
content.flavor: She's quite jealous of the Gallon-Sized Summoner.
content.text: The first minion you play each turn costs (1) less.

content.name: Secretkeeper
content.flavor: She promises not to tell anyone about that thing you did last night with that one person.
content.text: Whenever a Secret is played, gain +1/+1.

content.name: Mad Bomber
content.flavor: He's not really all that crazy, he is just not as careful with explosives as he should be.
content.text: Battlecry: Deal 3 damage randomly split between all other characters.

content.name: Tinkmaster Overspark
content.flavor: Tinkmaster Overspark nearly lost his Tinker's license after the Great Ironforge Squirrel Stampede of '09.
content.targetingArrowText: Transform a minion into a 5/5 or a 1/1 at random.
content.text: Battlecry: Transform another random minion into a 5/5 Devilsaur  or a 1/1 Squirrel.

content.name: Warsong Commander
content.flavor: The Warsong clan is such drama. It's really not worth it to become a commander.
content.howToEarn: Unlocked at Level 1.
content.howToEarnGolden: Unlocked at Level 36.
content.text: Your Charge minions have +1 Attack.

content.name: Mind Control Tech
content.flavor: Mind Control technology is getting better, but that's not saying much.
content.text: Battlecry: If your opponent has 4 or more minions, take  control of one at random.

content.name: Arcane Golem
content.flavor: Having Arcane golems at home really classes up the place, and as a bonus they are great conversation pieces.
content.text: Battlecry: Give your opponent a Mana Crystal.

content.name: Cabal Shadow Priest
content.flavor: You never know who may be secretly working for the Cabal....
content.targetingArrowText: Steal a minion that has 2 or less Attack.
content.text: Battlecry: Take control of an enemy minion that has 2 or less Attack.

content.name: Defender of Argus
content.flavor: You wouldn’t think that Argus would need this much defending.  But it does.
content.text: Battlecry: Give adjacent minions +1/+1 and Taunt.

content.name: Gadgetzan Auctioneer
content.flavor: He used to run the black market auction house, but there was just too much violence and he had to move.
content.text: Whenever you cast a spell, draw a card.

content.name: Loot Hoarder
content.flavor: Always roll need.
content.text: Deathrattle: Draw a card.

content.name: Abomination
content.flavor: Abominations enjoy Fresh Meat and long walks on the beach.
content.text: Taunt. Deathrattle: Deal 2 damage to ALL characters.

content.name: Lorewalker Cho
content.flavor: Lorewalker Cho archives and shares tales from the land of Pandaria, but his favorite story is the one where Joey and Phoebe go on a road trip.
content.text: Whenever a player casts a spell, put a copy into the other player’s hand.

content.name: Demolisher
content.flavor: Laying siege isn't fun for anyone.  It's not even all that effective, now that everyone has a flying mount.
content.text: At the start of your turn, deal 2 damage to a random enemy.

content.name: Coldlight Seer
content.flavor: The Coldlight murlocs reside in the darkest pits of the Abyssal Depths.  So no, there's no getting away from murlocs.
content.text: Battlecry: Give your other Murlocs +2 Health.

content.name: Mountain Giant
content.flavor: His mother said that he was just big boned.
content.text: Costs (1) less for each other card in your hand.

content.name: Cairne Bloodhoof
content.flavor: Cairne was killed by Garrosh, so... don't put this guy in a Warrior deck.  It's pretty insensitive.
content.text: Deathrattle: Summon a 4/5 Baine Bloodhoof.

content.name: Gelbin Mekkatorque
content.flavor: He's the leader of the gnomes, and an incredible inventor.  He's getting better, too; He turns things into chickens WAY less than he used to.
content.howToEarnGolden: This was rewarded to players who helped test the Store during the Beta.
content.text: Battlecry: Summon an AWESOME invention.

content.name: Leeroy Jenkins
content.flavor: At least he has Angry Chicken.
content.text: Charge. Battlecry: Summon two 1/1 Whelps for your opponent.

content.name: Eviscerate
content.flavor: There is a high cost to Eviscerating your opponent:  It takes a long time to get blood stains out of leather armor.
content.text: Deal $2 damage. Combo: Deal $4 damage instead.

content.name: Betrayal
content.flavor: Everyone has a price. Gnomes, for example, can be persuaded by stuffed animals and small amounts of chocolate.
content.text: Force an enemy minion to deal its damage to the minions next to it.

content.name: Conceal
content.flavor: Rogues conceal everything but their emotions.  You can't get 'em to shut up about feelings.
content.text: Give your minions Stealth until your next turn.

content.name: Fan of Knives
content.flavor: I wouldn't say I LOVE knives, but I'm definitely a fan.
content.howToEarn: Unlocked at Level 4.
content.howToEarnGolden: Unlocked at Level 28.
content.text: Deal $1 damage to all enemy minions. Draw a card.

content.name: Noble Sacrifice
content.flavor: We will always remember you, 'Defender!'
content.text: Secret: When an enemy attacks, summon a 2/1 Defender as the new target.

content.name: Defias Ringleader
content.flavor: He stole the deed to town years ago, so technically the town is his. He just calls people Scrub to be mean.
content.text: Combo: Summon a 2/1 Defias Bandit.

content.name: Eye for an Eye
content.flavor: Justice sometimes takes the form of a closed fist into a soft cheek.
content.text: Secret: When your hero takes damage, deal that much damage to the enemy hero.

content.name: Perdition's Blade
content.flavor: Perdition's Blade is Ragnaros's back-up weapon while Sulfuras is in the shop.
content.text: Battlecry: Deal 1 damage. Combo: Deal 2 instead.

content.name: SI:7 Agent
content.flavor: The agents of SI:7 are responsible for Stormwind's covert activities.  Their duties include espionage, assassination, and throwing surprise birthday parties for the royal family.
content.text: Combo: Deal 2 damage.

content.name: Redemption
content.flavor: I am not sure how you get demptioned the first time.  It’s a mystery!
content.text: Secret: When a friendly minion dies, return it to life with 1 Health.

content.name: Headcrack
content.flavor: When all else fails, nothing beats a swift whack upside the head.
content.text: Deal $2 damage to the enemy hero. Combo: Return this to your hand next turn.

content.name: Shadowstep
content.flavor: Rogue dance troops will sometimes Shadowstep away at the end of a performance.  Crowds love it.
content.text: Return a friendly minion to your hand. It costs (2) less.

content.name: Preparation
content.flavor: 'Be Prepared' - Rogue Motto
content.text: The next spell you cast this turn costs (3) less.

content.name: Wrath
content.flavor: The talk around the Ratchet Inn is that this card is too good and should be a Legendary.
content.text: Choose One - Deal $3 damage to a minion; or $1 damage and draw a card.

content.name: Mark of Nature
content.flavor: Druids call it the 'Mark of Nature.'  Everyone else calls it 'needing a bath.'
content.text: Choose One - Give a minion +4 Attack; or +4 Health and Taunt.

content.name: Soul of the Forest
content.flavor: 'Reforestation' is suddenly a terrifying word.
content.text: Give your minions 'Deathrattle: Summon a 2/2 Treant.'

content.name: Power of the Wild
content.flavor: Never look a panther in the eye.  Or is it 'Always look a panther in the eye'?  Well, it's one of those.
content.text: Choose One - Give your minions +1/+1; or Summon a 3/2 Panther.

content.name: Naturalize
content.flavor: Another one bites the dust.
content.text: Destroy a minion. Your opponent draws 2 cards.

content.name: Dire Wolf Alpha
content.flavor: We are pretty excited about the upcoming release of Dire Wolf Beta, just repost this sign for a chance at a key.
content.text: Adjacent minions have +1 Attack.

content.name: Nourish
content.flavor: Druids take nourishment from many things: the power of nature, the songbird's chirp, a chocolate cake.
content.text: Choose One - Gain 2 Mana Crystals; or Draw 3 cards.

content.name: Druid of the Claw
content.flavor: Cat or Bear?  Cat or Bear?!  I just cannot CHOOSE!
content.text: Choose One - Transform into a 4/4 with Charge; or a 4/6 with Taunt.

content.name: Keeper of the Grove
content.flavor: These guys just show up and start Keeping your Groves without even asking.
content.text: Choose One - Deal 2 damage; or Silence a minion.

content.name: Innervate
content.flavor: Some druids still have flashbacks from strangers yelling 'Innervate me!!' at them.
content.howToEarn: Unlocked at Level 1.
content.howToEarnGolden: Unlocked at Level 36.
content.text: Gain 1 Mana Crystal this turn only.

content.name: Emperor Cobra
content.flavor: The Sholazar Basin is home to a lot of really horrible things. If you're going to visit, wear bug spray.  And plate armor.
content.text: Poisonous

content.name: Starfire
content.flavor: Balance is important to druids.  This card is perfectly balanced.
content.howToEarn: Unlocked at Level 2.
content.howToEarnGolden: Unlocked at Level 45.
content.text: Deal $5 damage. Draw a card.

content.name: Ancient of War
content.flavor: Young Night Elves love to play 'Who can get the Ancient of War to Uproot?'  You lose if you get crushed to death.
content.text: Choose One - +5 Attack; or +5 Health and Taunt.

content.name: Lightning Bolt
content.flavor: Lightning Bolt! Lightning Bolt! Lightning Bolt!
content.text: Deal $3 damage. Overload: (1)

content.name: Lava Burst
content.flavor: It's like an ocean of liquid magma in your mouth!
content.text: Deal $5 damage. Overload: (2)

content.name: Dust Devil
content.flavor: Westfall is full of dust devils. And buzzards. And crazed golems. And pirates. Why does anyone live here?
content.text: Windfury. Overload: (2)

content.name: Totemic Might
content.flavor: Totem-stomping is no longer recommended.
content.howToEarn: Unlocked at Level 6.
content.howToEarnGolden: Unlocked at Level 28.
content.text: Give your Totems +2 Health.

content.name: Earth Shock
content.flavor: Earth Shock? Shouldn't it be 'Azeroth Shock'?
content.text: Silence a minion, then deal $1 damage to it.

content.name: Hex
content.flavor: If you Hex a Murloc... it really isn't much of a change, is it?
content.howToEarn: Unlocked at Level 1.
content.howToEarnGolden: Unlocked at Level 47.
content.text: Transform a minion into a 0/1 Frog with Taunt.

content.name: Stormforged Axe
content.flavor: Yo, that's a nice axe.
content.text: Overload: (1)

content.name: Feral Spirit
content.flavor: Spirit wolves are like regular wolves with pom-poms.
content.text: Summon two 2/3 Spirit Wolves with Taunt. Overload: (2)

content.name: Baron Geddon
content.flavor: Baron Geddon was Ragnaros's foremost lieutenant, until he got FIRED.
content.text: At the end of your turn, deal 2 damage to ALL other characters.

content.name: Earth Elemental
content.flavor: Nothing beats rock.
content.text: Taunt Overload: (3)

content.name: Forked Lightning
content.flavor: If you combine it with Spooned Lightning and Knived Lightning, you have the full dining set.
content.text: Deal $2 damage to 2 random enemy minions. Overload: (2)

content.name: Unbound Elemental
content.flavor: Unlike bound elementals, Unbound ones really enjoy a night on the town.
content.text: Whenever you play a card with Overload, gain +1/+1.

content.name: Lightning Storm
content.flavor: An umbrella won't be effective, I'm afraid.
content.text: Deal $2-$3 damage to all enemy minions. Overload: (2)

content.name: Ethereal Arcanist
content.flavor: The ethereals are wrapped in cloth to give form to their non-corporeal bodies. Also because it's nice and soft.
content.text: If you control a Secret at the end of your turn, gain +2/+2.

content.name: Cone of Cold
content.flavor: Magi of the Kirin Tor were casting Cubes of Cold for many years before Cones came into fashion some 90 years ago.
content.text: Freeze a minion and the minions next to it, and deal $1 damage to them.

content.name: Arcane Missiles
content.flavor: You'd think you'd be able to control your missiles a little better since you're a powerful mage and all.
content.howToEarn: Unlocked at Level 1.
content.howToEarnGolden: Unlocked at Level 32.
content.text: Deal $3 damage randomly split among all enemies.

content.name: Shiv
content.flavor: Rogues are experts at SHIV-al-ry.
content.howToEarn: Unlocked at Level 6.
content.howToEarnGolden: Unlocked at Level 45.
content.text: Deal $1 damage. Draw a card.

content.name: Pyroblast
content.flavor: Take the time for an evil laugh after you draw this card.
content.text: Deal $10 damage.

content.name: Frost Elemental
content.flavor: When a Water elemental and an Ice elemental love each other VERY much...
content.text: Battlecry: Freeze a character.

content.name: Azure Drake
content.flavor: They initially planned to be the Beryl or Cerulean drakes, but those felt a tad too pretentious.
content.text: Spell Damage +1 Battlecry: Draw a card.

content.name: Counterspell
content.flavor: What's the difference between a mage playing with Counterspell and a mage who isn't?  The mage who isn't is getting Pyroblasted in the face.
content.text: Secret: When your opponent casts a spell, Counter it.

content.name: Ice Barrier
content.flavor: This is Rank 1.  Rank 2 is Chocolate Milk Barrier.
content.text: Secret: When your hero is attacked, gain 8 Armor.

content.name: Mirror Entity
content.flavor: 'You go first.' - Krush'gor the Behemoth, to his pet boar.
content.text: Secret: After your opponent plays a minion, summon a copy of it.

content.name: Ice Block
content.flavor: Ice is nice, and will suffice!
content.text: Secret: When your hero takes fatal damage, prevent it and become Immune this turn.

content.name: Ragnaros the Firelord
content.flavor: Ragnaros was summoned by the Dark Iron dwarves, who were eventually enslaved by the Firelord.  Summoning Ragnaros often doesn’t work out the way you want it to.
content.text: Can't attack. At the end of your turn, deal 8 damage to a random enemy.

content.name: Felguard
content.flavor: Yes, he'll fight for you.  BUT HE'S NOT GOING TO LIKE IT.
content.text: Taunt Battlecry: Destroy one of your Mana Crystals.

content.name: Mortal Coil
content.flavor: If your spells look like horrifying skulls, let's be honest, you should get to draw some cards.
content.howToEarn: Unlocked at Level 4.
content.howToEarnGolden: Unlocked at Level 43.
content.text: Deal $1 damage to a minion. If that kills it, draw a card.

content.name: Shadowflame
content.flavor: Start with a powerful minion and stir in Shadowflame and you have a good time!
content.text: Destroy a friendly minion and deal its Attack damage to all enemy minions.

content.name: Void Terror
content.flavor: If you put this into your deck, you WILL lose the trust of your other minions.
content.text: Battlecry: Destroy both adjacent minions and gain  their Attack and Health.

content.name: Succubus
content.flavor: Warlocks have it pretty good.
content.howToEarn: Unlocked at Level 1.
content.howToEarnGolden: Unlocked at Level 40.
content.text: Battlecry: Discard a random card.

content.name: Soulfire
content.flavor: Are you lighting a soul on fire? Or burning someone with your OWN soul? This seems like an important distinction.
content.howToEarn: Unlocked at Level 6.
content.howToEarnGolden: Unlocked at Level 28.
content.text: Deal $4 damage. Discard a random card.

content.name: Siphon Soul
content.flavor: You probably should avoid siphoning your own soul.  You might create some kind of weird infinite loop.
content.text: Destroy a minion. Restore #3 Health to your hero.

content.name: Doomguard
content.flavor: Summoning a doomguard is risky. Someone is going to die.
content.text: Charge. Battlecry: Discard two random cards.

content.name: Twisting Nether
content.flavor: The Twisting Nether is a formless place of magic and illusion and destroyed minions.
content.text: Destroy all minions.

content.name: Pit Lord
content.flavor: Mannoroth, Magtheridon, and Brutallus may be dead, but it turns out there are a LOT of pit lords.
content.text: Battlecry: Deal 5 damage to your hero.

content.name: Summoning Portal
content.flavor: NOT LESS THAN 1!  Don't get any ideas!
content.text: Your minions cost (2) less, but not less than (1).

content.name: Power Overwhelming
content.flavor: We cannot even describe how horrible the death is.  It's CRAZY bad!  Maybe worse than that.  Just don't do it.
content.text: Give a friendly minion +4/+4 until end of turn. Then, it dies. Horribly.

content.name: Sense Demons
content.flavor: Generally demons are pretty obvious and you don’t need a spell to sense them.
content.text: Draw 2 Demons from your deck.

content.name: Flame Imp
content.flavor: Imps like being on fire.  They just do.
content.text: Battlecry: Deal 3 damage to your hero.

content.name: Bane of Doom
content.flavor: My advice to you is to avoid Doom, if possible.
content.text: Deal $2 damage to a character. If that kills it, summon a random Demon.

content.name: Lord Jaraxxus
content.flavor: 'TRIFLING GNOME! YOUR ARROGANCE WILL BE YOUR UNDOING!!!!'
content.text: Battlecry: Destroy your hero and replace it with Lord Jaraxxus.

content.name: Silence
content.flavor: Reserved for enemy spellcasters, evil liches from beyond the grave, and karaoke nights at the Grim Guzzler.
content.text: Silence a minion.

content.name: Shadow Madness
content.flavor: You can rationalize it all you want, it's still a mean thing to do.
content.text: Gain control of an enemy minion with 3 or less Attack until end of turn.

content.name: Lightspawn
content.flavor: Spawn of the Light? Or Pawn of the Lights?
content.text: This minion's Attack is always equal to its Health.

content.name: Thoughtsteal
content.flavor: 'What do you get when you cast Thoughtsteal on an Orc?  Nothing!' - Tauren joke
content.text: Copy 2 cards in your opponent's deck and add them to your hand.

content.name: Lightwell
content.flavor: It isn't clear if people ignore the Lightwell, or if it is just invisible.
content.text: At the start of your turn, restore 3 Health to a damaged friendly character.

content.name: Mindgames
content.flavor: Sometimes it feels like this is all a game.
content.text: Put a copy of a random minion from your opponent's deck into the battlefield.

content.name: Divine Favor
content.flavor: This is not just a favor, but a divine one, like helping someone move a couch with a fold out bed!
content.text: Draw cards until you have as many in hand as your opponent.

content.name: Prophet Velen
content.flavor: He's been exiled from his home, and all his brothers turned evil, but otherwise he doesn't have a lot to complain about.
content.text: Double the damage and healing of your spells and Hero Power.

content.name: Lay on Hands
content.flavor: A grammatically awkward life saver.
content.text: Restore #8 Health. Draw 3 cards.

content.name: Blessed Champion
content.flavor: This card causes double the trouble AND double the fun.
content.text: Double a minion's Attack.

content.name: Humility
content.flavor: This card makes something really damp.  Oh wait.  That's 'Humidity.'
content.howToEarn: Unlocked at Level 6.
content.howToEarnGolden: Unlocked at Level 28.
content.text: Change a minion's Attack to 1.

content.name: Argent Protector
content.flavor: 'I'm not saying you can dodge fireballs.  I'm saying with this shield, you won't have to.'
content.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly minion Divine Shield.

content.name: Blessing of Wisdom
content.flavor: Apparently with wisdom comes the knowledge that you should probably be attacking every turn.
content.text: Choose a minion. Whenever it attacks, draw a card.

content.name: Holy Wrath
content.flavor: C'mon Molten Giant!!
content.text: Draw a card and deal damage equal to its Cost.

content.name: Sword of Justice
content.flavor: I dub you Sir Loin of Beef!
content.text: After you summon a minion, give it +1/+1 and this loses 1 Durability.

content.name: Hand of Protection
content.flavor: This spell has been renamed so many times, even paladins don’t know what it should be called anymore.
content.howToEarn: Unlocked at Level 1.
content.howToEarnGolden: Unlocked at Level 23.
content.text: Give a minion Divine Shield.

content.name: Repentance
content.flavor: Repentance often comes in the moment before obliteration. Curious.
content.text: Secret: After your opponent plays a minion, reduce its Health to 1.

content.name: Aldor Peacekeeper
content.flavor: The Aldor hate two things: the Scryers and smooth jazz.
content.text: Battlecry: Change an enemy minion's Attack to 1.

content.name: Tirion Fordring
content.flavor: If you haven't heard the Tirion Fordring theme song, it's because it doesn't exist.
content.text: Divine Shield, Taunt Deathrattle: Equip a 5/3 Ashbringer.

content.name: Avenging Wrath
content.flavor: Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham!
content.text: Deal $8 damage randomly split among all enemies.

content.name: Tauren Warrior
content.flavor: Tauren Warrior: Champion of Mulgore, Slayer of Quilboar, Rider of Thunderbluff Elevators.
content.text: Taunt Enrage: +3 Attack.

content.name: Slam
content.flavor: 'Dun da dun, dun da dun': if you've heard an ogre sing this, it's too late.
content.text: Deal $2 damage to a minion. If it survives, draw a card.

content.name: Battle Rage
content.flavor: 'You won't like me when I'm angry.'
content.text: Draw a card for each damaged friendly character.

content.name: Amani Berserker
content.flavor: If an Amani berserker asks 'Joo lookin' at me?!', the correct response is 'Nah, mon'.
content.text: Enrage: +3 Attack

content.name: Mogu'shan Warden
content.flavor: All these guys ever do is talk about the Thunder King.   BOOOORRRINNG!
content.text: Taunt

content.name: Arathi Weaponsmith
content.flavor: 50% off fist weapons, limited time only!
content.text: Battlecry: Equip a 2/2 weapon.

content.name: Gurubashi Berserker
content.flavor: No Pain, No Gain.
content.howToEarnGolden: Unlocked at Warlock Level 57.
content.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, gain +3 Attack.

content.name: Whirlwind
content.flavor: The way to tell seasoned warriors from novice ones: the novices yell 'wheeeee' while whirlwinding.

content.howToEarnGolden: Unlocked at Level 32.
content.text: Deal $1 damage to ALL minions.

content.name: Armorsmith
content.flavor: She accepts guild funds for repairs!
content.text: Whenever a friendly minion takes damage, gain 1 Armor.

content.name: Shieldbearer
content.flavor: Have you seen the size of the shields in this game??  This is no easy job.
content.text: Taunt

content.name: Brawl
content.flavor: Do you know the first rule of Brawl Club?
content.text: Destroy all minions except one. (chosen randomly)

content.name: Mortal Strike
content.flavor: 'If you only use one ability, use Mortal Strike.' - The Warrior Code, Line 6
content.text: Deal $4 damage. If you have 12 or less Health, deal $6 instead.

content.name: Upgrade!
content.flavor: Easily worth 50 DKP.
content.text: If you have a weapon, give it +1/+1. Otherwise equip a 1/3 weapon.

content.name: Shield Slam
content.flavor: 'What is a better weapon? The sharp one your enemies expect, or the blunt one they ignore?' - The Art of Warrior, Chapter 9
content.text: Deal 1 damage to a minion for each Armor you have.

content.name: Gorehowl
content.flavor: Grommash Hellscream's famous axe.  Somehow this ended up in Prince Malchezaar's possession.  Quite the mystery!
content.text: Attacking a minion costs 1 Attack instead of 1 Durability.

content.name: Raging Worgen
content.flavor: If he's raging now, just wait until he gets nerfed.
content.text: Enrage: Windfury and +1 Attack.

content.name: Grommash Hellscream
content.flavor: Grommash drank the tainted blood of Mannoroth, dooming the orcs to green skin and red eyes!  Maybe not his best decision.
content.text: Charge Enrage: +6 Attack

content.name: Murloc Tidehunter
content.flavor: 'Death will rise, from the tides!'
content.howToEarnGolden: Unlocked at Rogue Level 53.
content.text: Battlecry: Summon a 1/1 Murloc Scout.

content.name: Murloc Warleader
content.flavor: Do Murlocs ever get tired of making the same old sound?  Nope!  Mrglglrglglglglglglgl!
content.text: Your other Murlocs have +2 Attack.

content.name: Grimscale Oracle
content.flavor: These are the brainy murlocs.  It turns out that doesn’t mean much.

content.text: Your other Murlocs have +1 Attack.

content.name: Murloc Tidecaller
content.flavor: This guy gets crazy strong at family reunions.
content.text: Whenever you summon a Murloc, gain +1 Attack.

content.name: Patient Assassin
content.flavor: He’s not really that patient. It just takes a while for someone to walk by that he can actually reach.
content.text: Stealth  Poisonous

content.name: Scavenging Hyena
content.flavor: Hyenas prefer the bones of kodos or windserpents, but they'll eat pretty much anything.  Even Brussels sprouts.

content.name: Misdirection
content.flavor: Sometimes it's as simple as putting on a fake mustache and pointing at someone else.
content.text: Secret: When an enemy attacks your hero, instead it attacks another random character.

content.name: Savannah Highmane
content.flavor: In the jungle, the mighty jungle, the lion gets slowly consumed by hyenas.
content.text: Deathrattle: Summon two 2/2 Hyenas.

content.name: Eaglehorn Bow
content.flavor: First Lesson: Put the pointy end in the other guy.
content.text: Whenever a friendly Secret is revealed, gain +1 Durability.

content.name: Explosive Shot
content.flavor: Pull the pin, count to 5, then shoot.  Then duck.
content.text: Deal $5 damage to a minion and $2 damage to adjacent ones.

content.name: Unleash the Hounds
content.flavor: You must read the name of this card out loud each time you play it.
content.text: For each enemy minion, summon a 1/1 Hound with Charge.

content.name: Kill Command
content.flavor: 'Kill!', he commanded.
content.howToEarn: Unlocked at Level 10.
content.howToEarnGolden: Unlocked at Level 49.
content.text: Deal $3 damage. If you control a Beast, deal $5 damage instead.

content.name: King Krush
content.flavor: The best defense against King Krush is to have someone you don’t like standing in front of you.
content.text: Charge

content.name: Flare
content.flavor: Not only does it reveal your enemies, but it's also great for parties!
content.text: All minions lose Stealth. Destroy all enemy Secrets. Draw a card.

content.name: Bestial Wrath
content.flavor: The seething wrath is just beneath the surface.  Beneath that is wild abandon, followed by slight annoyance.
content.text: Give a friendly Beast +2 Attack and Immune this turn.

content.name: Snake Trap
content.flavor: Why did it have to be snakes?
content.text: Secret: When one of your minions is attacked, summon three 1/1 Snakes.

content.name: Harvest Golem
content.flavor: 'Overheat threshold exceeded. System failure. Wheat clog in port two. Shutting down.'
content.text: Deathrattle: Summon a 2/1 Damaged Golem.

content.name: Nat Pagle
content.flavor: Nat Pagle, Azeroth's premier fisherman!  He invented the Auto-Angler 3000, the Extendo-Pole 3000, and the Lure-o-matic 2099 (still in testing).
content.text: At the start of your turn, you have a 50% chance to draw an extra card.

content.name: Harrison Jones
content.flavor: “That belongs in the Hall of Explorers!”
content.text: Battlecry: Destroy your opponent's weapon and draw cards equal to its Durability.

content.name: Archmage Antonidas
content.flavor: Antonidas was the Grand Magus of the Kirin Tor, and Jaina's mentor.  This was a big step up from being Grand Magus of Jelly Donuts.
content.text: Whenever you cast a spell, add a 'Fireball' spell to your hand.

content.name: Nozdormu
content.flavor: Time to write some flavor text.
content.text: Players only have 15 seconds to take their turns.

content.name: Alexstrasza
content.flavor: Alexstrasza the Life-Binder brings life and hope to everyone.  Except Deathwing.  And Malygos.  And Nekros.
content.text: Battlecry: Set a hero's remaining Health to 15.

content.name: Onyxia
content.flavor: Onyxia long manipulated the Stormwind Court by disguising herself as Lady Katrana Prestor.   You would have thought that the giant wings and scales would have been a giveaway.
content.text: Battlecry: Summon 1/1 Whelps until your side of the battlefield is full.

content.name: Malygos
content.flavor: Malygos hates it when mortals use magic.  He gets so mad!
content.text: Spell Damage +5

content.name: Faceless Manipulator
content.flavor: The Faceless Ones are servants of Yogg-Saron, and they feed on fear. Right now they are feeding on your fear of accidentally disenchanting all your good cards.
content.targetingArrowText: Become a copy of a minion.
content.text: Battlecry: Choose a minion and become a copy of it.

content.name: Flametongue Totem
content.flavor: Totemsmiths like to use the rarest woods for their totems.  There are even rumors of totems made of Ironbark Protectors.
content.howToEarn: Unlocked at Level 4.
content.howToEarnGolden: Unlocked at Level 43.
content.text: Adjacent minions have +2 Attack.

content.name: Doomhammer
content.flavor: Orgrim Doomhammer gave this legendary weapon to Thrall.  His name is a total coincidence.
content.text: Windfury, Overload: (2)

content.name: Bite
content.flavor: Chew your food!
content.text: Give your hero +4 Attack this turn. Gain 4 Armor.

content.name: Force of Nature
content.flavor: 'I think I'll just nap under these trees. Wait... AAAAAHHH!' - Blinkfizz, the Unfortunate Gnome
content.text: Summon three 2/2 Treants.

content.name: Ysera
content.flavor: Ysera rules the Emerald Dream.  Which is some kind of green-mirror-version of the real world, or something?
content.text: At the end of your turn, add a Dream Card to your hand.

content.name: Cenarius
content.flavor: Yes, he's a demigod. No, he doesn't need to wear a shirt.
content.text: Choose One - Give your other minions +2/+2; or Summon two 2/2 Treants with Taunt.

content.name: Mana Tide Totem
content.flavor: It is said that some shaman can say 'Floatin' totem' 10 times, fast.
content.text: At the end of your turn, draw a card.

content.name: The Beast
content.flavor: He lives in Blackrock Mountain.  He eats Gnomes.  That's pretty much it.
content.text: Deathrattle: Summon a 3/3 Finkle Einhorn for your opponent.

content.name: Savagery
content.flavor: It is true that some druids are savage, but others still enjoy a quiet moment and a spot of tea.
content.text: Deal damage equal to your hero's Attack to a minion.

content.name: Sap
content.flavor: Rogues love sappy movies.

content.howToEarnGolden: Unlocked at Level 40.
content.text: Return an enemy minion to your opponent's hand.

content.name: Dalaran Mage
content.flavor: You don't see a lot of Dalaran warriors.

content.name: Priestess of Elune
content.flavor: If she threatens to 'moon' you, it's not what you think.
content.text: Battlecry: Restore 4 Health to your hero.

content.name: Ancient Mage
content.flavor: Sometimes he forgets and just wanders into someone else's game.
content.text: Battlecry: Give adjacent minions Spell Damage +1.

content.name: Sea Giant
content.flavor: See?  Giant.

content.name: Windspeaker
content.flavor: Is there anything worse than a Windspeaker with halitosis?

content.howToEarnGolden: Unlocked at Level 45.

content.name: Blood Knight
content.flavor: The Blood Knights get their holy powers from the Sunwell, which you should NOT bathe in.
content.text: Battlecry: All minions lose Divine Shield. Gain +3/+3 for each Shield lost.

content.name: Auchenai Soulpriest
content.flavor: The Auchenai know the end is coming, but they're not sure when.
content.text: Your cards and powers that restore Health now deal damage instead.

content.name: Nightblade
content.flavor: Your face is the place you'd probably least like a dagger, and where rogues are most likely to deliver them.
content.howToEarnGolden: Unlocked at Druid Level 53.
content.text: Battlecry: Deal 3 damage to the enemy hero.

content.name: Vaporize
content.flavor: Rumor has it that Deathwing brought about the Cataclysm after losing a game to this card.  We may never know the truth.
content.text: Secret: When a minion attacks your hero, destroy it.

content.name: Cult Master
content.flavor: She may be an evil cult master, but she still calls her parents once a week.
content.text: Whenever one of your other minions dies, draw a card.

content.name: Demonfire
content.flavor: Demonfire is like regular fire except for IT NEVER STOPS BURNING HELLLPPP
content.text: Deal $2 damage to a minion. If it’s a friendly Demon, give it +2/+2 instead.
