content.flavor: She would enjoy the job a lot more if she just could get the imps to QUIT BITING HER.
content.text: At the end of your turn, deal 1 damage to this minion  and summon a 1/1 Imp.

content.name: Cruel Taskmaster
content.flavor: 'I'm going to need you to come in on Sunday.' - Cruel Taskmaster
content.text: Battlecry: Deal 1 damage to a minion and give it +2 Attack.

content.flavor: He used to work as an accountant before he tried his hand at Berserkering.

content.name: Shield Block
content.flavor: Shields were invented because Face Block is USELESS.

content.flavor: Apprentices are great for bossing around.  'Conjure me some mana buns! And a coffee!  Make that a mana coffee!'
content.text: Your spells cost (1) less.

content.name: Snipe
content.flavor: A great sniper hits the spot.  Just like a delicious flank of boar. Mmmmm.
content.text: Secret: After your opponent plays a minion, deal $4 damage to it.

content.flavor: It traps your food AND cooks it for you!
content.text: Secret: When your hero is attacked, deal $2 damage to all enemies.

content.name: Kirin Tor Mage
content.flavor: The Kirin Tor reside in the floating city of Dalaran.  How do you make a Dalaran float?  Two scoops of ice cream, one scoop of Dalaran.
content.text: Battlecry: The next Secret you play this turn costs (0).

content.name: Edwin VanCleef
content.flavor: He led the Stonemasons in the reconstruction of Stormwind, and when the nobles refused to pay, he founded the Defias Brotherhood to, well, deconstruct Stormwind.
content.text: Combo: Gain +2/+2 for each other card you've played this turn.

content.name: Illidan Stormrage
content.flavor: Illidan's brother, Malfurion, imprisoned him beneath Hyjal for 10,000 years.  Stormrages are not good at letting go of grudges.

content.name: Mana Wraith
content.flavor: They come out at night to eat leftover mana crystals. 'Mmmmmm,' they say.

content.flavor: Accuracy is not a highly valued trait among the mok'nathal.  Deadliness is near the top, though.

content.flavor: We are all special unique snowflakes... with 1 Health.

content.flavor: He gets terrible heartburn.  BECAUSE HE IS FULL OF LAVA.

content.name: Circle of Healing
content.flavor: It isn't really a circle.

content.text: Destroy a minion with 5 or more Attack.

content.name: Temple Enforcer
content.flavor: He also moonlights Thursday nights as a bouncer at the Pig and Whistle Tavern.
content.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly minion +3 Health.

content.name: Holy Fire
content.flavor: Often followed by Holy Smokes!

content.text: 50% chance to attack the wrong enemy.

content.text: Windfury

content.name: Annoy-o-Tron
content.flavor: The inventor of the Annoy-o-Tron was immediately expelled from Tinkerschool, Tinkertown, and was eventually exiled from the Eastern Kingdoms altogether.
content.text: Taunt Divine Shield

content.name: Siege Engine
content.flavor: Wintergrasp Keep's only weakness!
content.text: Whenever you gain Armor, give this minion +1 Attack.

content.name: Steamwheedle Sniper
content.flavor: Goblins seldom have the patience for sniping. Most prefer lobbing explosives.
content.text: Your Hero Power can target minions.

content.name: Ogre Ninja
content.flavor: He didn't have the grades to get into ninja school, but his dad pulled some strings.
content.text: Stealth 50% chance to attack the wrong enemy.

content.name: Illuminator
content.flavor: 'LUMOS!' is not what they yell. What do you think this is, Hogwarts?
content.text: If you control a Secret at the end of your turn, restore 4 Health to your hero.

content.name: Madder Bomber
content.flavor: Dang, Bomber, calm down.
content.text: Battlecry: Deal 6 damage randomly split between all other characters.

content.name: Arcane Nullifier X-21
content.flavor: There was some hard talk between gnome magi and engineers about inventing this mech.
content.text: Taunt Can't be targeted by spells or Hero Powers.

content.name: Gnomish Experimenter
content.flavor: He's legitimately surprised every time he turns himself into a chicken.
content.text: Battlecry: Draw a card. If it's a minion, transform it into a Chicken.

content.name: Target Dummy
content.flavor: The engineering equivalent of a 'Kick Me' sticker.
content.text: Taunt

content.name: Jeeves
content.flavor: This robot is a lean, mean, butlerin' machine.
content.text: At the end of each player's turn, that player draws until they have 3 cards.

content.name: Goblin Sapper
content.flavor: He’s not such a binge exploder anymore. These days, he only explodes socially.
content.text: Has +4 Attack while your opponent has 6 or more cards in hand.

content.name: Piloted Shredder
content.flavor: Once upon a time, only goblins piloted shredders. These days, everyone from Doomsayer to Lorewalker Cho seems to ride one.
content.text: Deathrattle: Summon a random 2-Cost minion.

content.name: Lil' Exorcist
content.flavor: Warlocks have the town exorcist on speed dial in case they unleash the wrong demon.
content.text: Taunt Battlecry: Gain +1/+1 for each enemy Deathrattle minion.

content.name: Gnomeregan Infantry
content.flavor: The gnomes are valiant and ready to return to their irradiated, poorly ventilated homeland!
content.text: Charge Taunt

content.name: Bomb Lobber
content.flavor: He lobbies Orgrimmar daily on behalf of bombs.
content.text: Battlecry: Deal 4 damage to a random enemy minion.

content.name: Floating Watcher
content.flavor: 'Evil Eye Watcher of Doom' was the original name, but marketing felt it was a bit too aggressive.
content.text: Whenever your hero takes damage on your turn, gain +2/+2.

content.name: Scarlet Purifier
content.flavor: The Scarlet Crusade is doing market research to find out if the 'Mauve Crusade' would be better received.
content.text: Battlecry: Deal 2 damage to all minions with Deathrattle.

content.name: Tinkertown Technician
content.flavor: Won't you take me to... Tinkertown?
content.text: Battlecry: If you have a Mech, gain +1/+1 and add a Spare Part to your hand.

content.name: Micro Machine
content.flavor: This card is the real thing.
content.text: At the start of each turn, gain +1 Attack.

content.name: Hobgoblin
content.flavor: Hobgoblins are meeting next week to discuss union benefits.  First on the list: dental plan.
content.text: Whenever you play a 1-Attack minion, give it +2/+2.

content.name: Piloted Sky Golem
content.flavor: The pinnacle of goblin engineering. Includes an espresso machine and foot massager.
content.text: Deathrattle: Summon a random 4-Cost minion.

content.name: Junkbot
content.flavor: One bot's junk is another bot's AWESOME UPGRADE!
content.text: Whenever a friendly Mech dies, gain +2/+2.

content.name: Enhance-o Mechano
content.flavor: His enhancements are gluten free!
content.text: Battlecry: Give your other minions Windfury, Taunt, or Divine Shield (at random).

content.name: Recombobulator
content.flavor: For when you didn’t combobulate quite right the first time around.
content.text: Battlecry: Transform a friendly minion into a random minion with the same Cost.

content.name: Mini-Mage
content.flavor: He is sometimes found hiding in the treasure chest in the Gurubashi Arena.
content.text: Stealth Spell Damage +1

content.name: Dr. Boom
content.flavor: MARVEL AT HIS MIGHT!
content.text: Battlecry: Summon two 1/1 Boom Bots. WARNING: Bots may explode.

content.name: Mimiron's Head
content.flavor: Do not push the big red button!
content.text: At the start of your turn, if you have at least 3 Mechs, destroy them all and form V-07-TR-0N.

content.name: Mogor the Ogre
content.flavor: Mogor helped reopen the Dark Portal once. You know you're in trouble when you have to rely on an ogre.
content.text: All minions have a 50% chance to attack the wrong enemy.

content.name: Foe Reaper 4000
content.flavor: Foe reaping is really not so different from harvest reaping, at the end of the day.
content.text: Also damages the minions next to whomever it attacks.

content.name: Sneed's Old Shredder
content.flavor: When Sneed was defeated in the Deadmines, his shredder was sold at auction to an anonymous buyer. (Probably Hogger.)
content.text: Deathrattle: Summon a random Legendary minion.

content.name: Toshley
content.flavor: Something about power converters.
content.text: Battlecry and Deathrattle: Add a Spare Part card to your hand.

content.name: Mekgineer Thermaplugg
content.flavor: He was obsessed with explosives until he discovered knitting. Now he yells, “SWEATERS! MORE SWEATERS!”
content.text: Whenever an enemy minion dies, summon a Leper Gnome.

content.name: Gazlowe
content.flavor: Gazlowe was voted 'Most Likely to Explode' in high school.
content.text: Whenever you cast a 1-mana spell, add a random Mech to your hand.

content.name: Troggzor the Earthinator
content.flavor: He keeps earthinating the countryside despite attempts to stop him.
content.text: Whenever your opponent casts a spell, summon a Burly Rockjaw Trogg.

content.name: Blingtron 3000
content.flavor: PREPARE PARTY SERVOS FOR IMMEDIATE DEPLOYMENT.
content.text: Battlecry: Equip a random weapon for each player.

content.name: Hemet Nesingwary
content.flavor: It's hard to make a living as a hunter in a world where beasts instantly reappear minutes after you kill them.
content.text: Battlecry: Destroy a Beast.

content.name: Clockwork Giant
content.flavor: He and Mountain Giant don't get along.
content.text: Costs (1) less for each card in your opponent's hand.

content.name: Wee Spellstopper
content.flavor: Bane of spellcasters and spelling bees everywhere.
content.text: Adjacent minions can't be targeted by spells or Hero Powers.

content.name: Soot Spewer
content.flavor: The inventor of the goblin shredder is involved in several patent disputes with the inventor of the soot spewer.
content.text: Spell Damage +1

content.name: Phantom Freebooter
content.flavor: There's no such thing as a free boot.
content.text: Battlecry: Gain stats equal to your weapon's.

content.name: Skelemancer
content.flavor: What do you mean there's no such thing as 'Skelemancy?' But 'Dinomancy' is ok?
content.text: Deathrattle: If it's your opponent's turn, summon an 8/8 Skeleton.

content.name: Exploding Bloatbat
content.flavor: We've all been there after a night of one-too-many funnel cakes.
content.text: Deathrattle: Deal 2 damage to all enemy minions.

content.name: Snowflipper Penguin
content.flavor: On land, a group of penguins is called a 'waddle.'

content.name: Rattling Rascal
content.flavor: Don't give up, skeleton!
content.text: Battlecry: Summon a 5/5 Skeleton. Deathrattle: Summon one for your opponent.

content.name: Grim Necromancer
content.flavor: WARNING: Skeletons will NOT explode.
content.text: Battlecry: Summon two 1/1 Skeletons.

content.name: Bone Drake
content.flavor: The bone drake brings all the dragons to the yard. He would teach you, but you have no cards.
content.text: Deathrattle: Add a random Dragon to your hand.

content.name: Sunborne Val'kyr
content.flavor: Bring valor to Odyn's halls, Champion!
content.text: Battlecry: Give adjacent minions +2 Health.

content.name: Cobalt Scalebane
content.flavor: You get a sword! And you get a sword! Everybody gets a sword!
content.text: At the end of your turn, give another random friendly minion +3 Attack.

content.name: Night Howler
content.flavor: Honestly, he howls during the day, too.
content.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, gain +2 Attack.

content.name: Venomancer
content.flavor: Eight times the death of regular-mancers.
content.text: Poisonous

content.name: Arrogant Crusader
content.flavor: To be honest, he was kind of a jerk even BEFORE he was bitten by that ghoul.
content.text: Deathrattle: If it's your opponent's turn, summon a 2/2 Ghoul.

content.name: Righteous Protector
content.flavor: Original name was Tubular Protector, but this seems more bodacious.
content.text: Taunt Divine Shield

content.name: Dark Conviction
content.flavor: In his court, Uther is judge, jury, AND executioner…
content.text: Set a minion's Attack and Health to 3.

content.name: Defile
content.flavor: This spell was originally designed to help warlocks clean up their hard drives.
content.text: Deal $1 damage to all minions. If any die, cast this again.

content.name: Fatespinner
content.flavor: Her clothing? Pure silk, of course.
content.text: Choose a Deathrattle (Secretly) - Deal 3 damage to all minions; or Give them +2/+2.

content.name: Toxic Arrow
content.flavor: What doesn't kill you makes you toxic.
content.text: Deal $2 damage to a minion. If it survives, give it Poisonous.

content.name: Webweave
content.flavor: O, what a tangled web we weave, hoping spiders dodge the cleave.
content.text: Summon two 1/2 Poisonous Spiders.

content.name: Druid of the Swarm
content.flavor: The Druid awoke from troubling dreams to find herself transformed into a giant spider.
content.text: Choose One - Transform into a 1/2 with Poisonous; or a 1/5 with Taunt.

content.name: Play Dead
content.flavor: He's a very literal dog.
content.text: Trigger a friendly minion's Deathrattle.

content.name: Spreading Plague
content.flavor: In the past, plagues were spread by mice or fleas. These days they're spread by elves.
content.text: Summon a 1/5 Scarab with Taunt. If your opponent has more minions, cast this again.

content.name: Drain Soul
content.flavor: Cleans even the toughest clogs with just a flick of the wrist!
content.text: Lifesteal Deal $2 damage to a minion.

content.name: Cryostasis
content.flavor: We'll thaw you out when we find a cure!
content.text: Give a minion +3/+3 and Freeze it.

content.name: Brrrloc
content.flavor: He may be frozen fish, but he fights fresh!
content.text: Battlecry: Freeze an enemy.

content.name: Mountainfire Armor
content.flavor: Excuse me. Your mountain is on fire.
content.text: Deathrattle: If it's your opponent's turn, gain 6 Armor.

content.name: Blood Razor
content.flavor: For the close shave that you've always wanted. Caution: Very sharp.
content.text: Battlecry and Deathrattle: Deal 1 damage to all minions.

content.name: Bone Baron
content.flavor: 'Oil,' 'Rail,' and 'Blubber' were already taken.
content.text: Deathrattle: Add two 1/1 Skeletons to your hand.

content.name: Vryghoul
content.flavor: It's pronounced VERY GHOUL. Don't let anyone tell you different.
content.text: Deathrattle: If it's your opponent's turn, summon a 2/2 Ghoul.

content.name: Ice Walker
content.flavor: Ice Walker you say? He doesn't have feet!
content.text: Your Hero Power also Freezes the target.

content.name: Ghastly Conjurer
content.flavor: Wearing purple after the holidays? GHASTLY!
content.text: Battlecry: Add a 'Mirror Image' spell to your hand.

content.name: Light's Sorrow
content.flavor: These sorrows cut deep.
content.text: After a friendly minion loses Divine Shield, gain +1 Attack.

content.name: Despicable Dreadlord
content.flavor: He's deathspicable.
content.text: At the end of your turn, deal 1 damage to all enemy minions.

content.name: Avalanche
content.flavor: One of our more snowbally cards.
content.text: Freeze a minion and deal $3 damage to adjacent ones.

content.name: Gnash
content.flavor: It's rude to gnash with your mouth open.
content.text: Give your hero +3 Attack this turn. Gain 3 Armor.

content.name: Drakkari Defender
content.flavor: Sometimes, the best defense is an offensive troll.
content.text: Taunt Overload: (3)

content.name: Frozen Clone
content.flavor: It's like déjà vu, times two.
content.text: Secret: After your opponent plays a minion, add two copies of it to your hand.

content.name: Doomed Apprentice
content.flavor: Jaina was never good at keeping up apprentices.
content.text: Your opponent's spells cost (1) more.

content.name: Ultimate Infestation
content.flavor: Ghouls in the pipe, five by five.
content.text: Deal $5 damage. Draw 5 cards. Gain 5 Armor. Summon a 5/5 Ghoul.

content.name: Glacial Mysteries
content.flavor: The secret is in the frosting.
content.text: Put one of each Secret from your deck into the battlefield.

content.name: Voodoo Hexxer
content.flavor: The Silver Hand recruits shuddered in terror when they saw the dreaded totem of the Hexxer: A tiny little snowman, impaled with pins.
content.text: Taunt Freeze any character damaged by this minion.

content.name: Ice Fishing
content.flavor: Glow fish, war fish... blow fish, more fish...
content.text: Draw 2 Murlocs from your deck.

content.name: Snowfury Giant
content.flavor: This minion goes all the way to 11!
content.text: Costs (1) less for each Mana Crystal you've Overloaded this game.

content.name: Dead Man's Hand
content.flavor: I got two pair, Rags and Armorsmiths. What you got?
content.text: Shuffle a copy of your hand into your deck.

content.name: Acherus Veteran
content.flavor: This is my Runeblade. There are many like it but this one is mine.
content.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly minion +1 Attack.

content.name: Tuskarr Fisherman
content.flavor: If you bring him 500 fish, he'll give you this sweet Kalu'ak Fishing Pole.
content.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly minion Spell Damage +1.

content.name: Fallen Sun Cleric
content.flavor: It's hard to keep a Shattered Sun Cleric down.
content.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly minion +1/+1.

content.name: Furnacefire Colossus
content.flavor: Smelts in his mouth, not in your hand.
content.text: Battlecry: Discard all weapons from your hand and gain their stats.

content.name: Grave Shambler
content.flavor: I think one of the necromancers got a little carried away.
content.text: Whenever your weapon is destroyed, gain +1/+1.

content.name: Tomb Lurker
content.flavor: She hangs out in all the tombs, but she rarely posts.
content.text: Battlecry: Add a random Deathrattle minion that died this game to your hand.

content.name: Ticking Abomination
content.flavor: Abomination. Emphasis on the second syllable.
content.text: Deathrattle: Deal 5 damage to your minions.

content.name: Venomstrike Trap
content.flavor: Snakes on a frozen plain.
content.text: Secret: When one of your minions is attacked, summon a 2/3 Poisonous Cobra.

content.name: Roll the Bones
content.flavor: Call it: Heads or Tailbone…
content.text: Draw a card. If it has Deathrattle, cast this again.

content.name: Professor Putricide
content.flavor: Among his more notable inventions: A tentacle-groomer, a plague that would wipe out all life on Azeroth, and a fidget spinner.
content.text: After you play a Secret, put a random Hunter Secret into the battlefield.

content.name: Treachery
content.flavor: Never look a gift minion in the mouth.
content.text: Choose a friendly minion and give it to your opponent.

content.name: Devour Mind
content.flavor: A mind is a terrible thing to waste. Seconds, anyone?
content.text: Copy 3 cards in your opponent's deck and add them to your hand.

content.name: Shadow Ascendant
content.flavor: When you're at the bottom, there's nowhere to ascend, but up.
content.text: At the end of your turn, give another random friendly minion +1/+1.

content.name: Acolyte of Agony
content.flavor: It takes many years of practiced study in order to fully master agony.
content.text: Lifesteal

content.name: Eternal Servitude
content.flavor: What do you mean I don't get overtime pay for this?!
content.text: Discover a friendly minion that died this game. Summon it.

content.name: Obsidian Statue
content.flavor: The original artist spent many hours with a fine chisel perfecting the facial expression for maximum tauntiness.
content.text: Taunt, Lifesteal Deathrattle: Destroy a  random enemy minion.

content.name: Archbishop Benedictus
content.flavor: Nobody expects the Archbishop's Benediction!
content.text: Battlecry: Shuffle a copy of your opponent's deck into your deck.

content.name: Howlfiend
content.flavor: The problem is that he carries those cards in his mouth.
content.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, discard a random card.

content.name: Deadscale Knight
content.flavor: His favorite spell is Chum Explosion.
content.text: Lifesteal

content.name: Leeching Poison
content.flavor: No actual leeches were harmed in the creation of this card.
content.text: Give your weapon Lifesteal this turn.

content.name: Doomerang
content.flavor: Guaranteed to return your weapon directly to your hand! (Wear gloves. Thick ones.)
content.text: Throw your weapon at a minion. It deals its damage, then returns to your hand.

content.name: Shadow Essence
content.flavor: Difficult to bottle up and sell. But it packs a punch.
content.text: Summon a 5/5 copy of a random minion in your deck.

content.name: Ice Breaker
content.flavor: A great way to end a conversation.
content.text: Destroy any Frozen minion damaged by this.

content.name: Animated Berserker
content.flavor: He'd be a lot easier to animate if he would just stand still.
content.text: After you play a minion, deal 1 damage to it.

content.name: Runeforge Haunter
content.flavor: Don't worry, he'll keep an eye on that for you.
content.text: During your turn, your weapon doesn't lose Durability.

content.name: Corpse Widow
content.flavor: Her marriage survived death, but it decayed pretty quickly after that.
content.text: Your Deathrattle cards cost (2) less.

content.name: Desperate Stand
content.flavor: They're grateful for the help, but most minions would prefer not dying in the first place.
content.text: Give a minion 'Deathrattle: Return this to life with 1 Health.'

content.name: Blackguard
content.flavor: 'Did I ever tell you the story of when I single-handedly took down a 29/29 C'thun?' - Reno Jackson
content.text: Whenever your hero is healed, deal that much damage to a random enemy minion.

content.name: Coldwraith
content.flavor: He's freezing his bones off!
content.text: Battlecry: If an enemy is Frozen, draw a card.

content.name: Corpse Raiser
content.flavor: He was just minding his business, farming corpses, when you meddling adventurers came along.
content.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly minion 'Deathrattle:   Resummon this minion.'

content.name: Forge of Souls
content.flavor: Powerful weaponry forged by Bronjahm, the Godfather of Souls.
content.text: Draw 2 weapons from your deck.

content.name: Moorabi
content.flavor: Most disturbing is how Moorabi covers all those frozen minions with flavored syrup.
content.text: Whenever another minion is Frozen, add a copy of it to your hand.

content.name: The Lich King
content.flavor: 'All that I am: anger, cruelty, vengeance, 8 attack - I bestow upon you, my chosen knight.'
content.text: Taunt At the end of your turn, add a random Death Knight card to your hand.

content.name: Rotface
content.flavor: Daddy! I think I made a Legendary!
content.text: Whenever this minion survives damage, summon a random Legendary minion.

content.name: Gnomeferatu
content.flavor: She prefers the term 'Glampire.'
content.text: Battlecry: Remove the top card of your opponent's deck.

content.name: Val'kyr Soulclaimer
content.flavor: My Ghoul friend is back and you're gonna be in trouble.
content.text: Whenever this minion survives damage, summon a 2/2 Ghoul.

content.name: Stitched Tracker
content.flavor: He's just exercising his right to bear arms.
content.text: Battlecry: Discover a copy of a minion in your deck.

content.name: Bearshark
content.flavor: 'Candygram.'
content.text: Can't be targeted by spells or Hero Powers.

content.name: Death Revenant
content.flavor: How's everyone doing? Hurt? Bleeding? Wounded? ... Excellent.
content.text: Battlecry: Gain +1/+1 for each damaged minion.

content.name: Saronite Chain Gang
content.flavor: Desperately needs some alone time.
content.text: Taunt Battlecry: Summon another Saronite Chain Gang.

content.name: Deathspeaker
content.flavor: It helps to speak really, really loud.
content.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly minion Immune this turn.

content.name: Wretched Tiller
content.flavor: If you ever tried to plow permafrost, you’d be wretched, too.
content.text: Whenever this minion attacks, deal 2 damage to the enemy hero.

content.name: Unwilling Sacrifice
content.flavor: Stand right... there. Perfect, perfect! Now don't move.
content.text: Choose a friendly minion. Destroy it and a random enemy minion.

content.name: Thrall, Deathseer
content.flavor: 'Do not be afraid. Approach. The dead will sleep… for now.'
content.text: Battlecry: Transform your minions into random ones that cost (2) more.

content.name: Happy Ghoul
content.flavor: When life gives you snow…
content.text: Costs (0) if your hero was healed this turn.

content.name: Skulking Geist
content.flavor: It's as though a million Jade Idols cried out, and were suddenly silenced.
content.text: Battlecry: Destroy all 1-Cost spells in both hands and decks.

content.name: Shallow Gravedigger
content.flavor: It's hard to put them six feet under when you're three feet tall.
content.text: Deathrattle: Add a random Deathrattle minion to your hand.

content.name: Bonemare
content.flavor: Attacks her job with unbridled enthusiasm.
content.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly minion +4/+4 and Taunt.

content.name: Nerubian Unraveler
content.flavor: He loves a good yarn.
content.text: Spells cost (2) more.

content.name: Howling Commander
content.flavor: Enlistment in her battalion comes with several pairs of earplugs.
content.text: Battlecry: Draw a Divine Shield minion from your deck.

content.name: Spirit Lash
content.flavor: We've got spirit, yes we do! We've got spirit, stolen from you!
content.text: Lifesteal Deal $1 damage to all minions.

content.name: Strongshell Scavenger
content.flavor: It isn't 'grave robbing' when there's no grave. It's just scavenging…
content.text: Battlecry: Give your Taunt minions +2/+2.

content.name: Crypt Lord
content.flavor: The original fifth beetle!
content.text: Taunt After you summon a minion,  gain +1 Health.

content.name: Plague Scientist
content.flavor: The excruciating pain means it's working!
content.text: Combo: Give a friendly minion Poisonous.

content.name: Deathaxe Punisher
content.flavor: Don't fear the Arcanite Reaper.
content.text: Battlecry: Give a random Lifesteal minion in your hand +2/+2.

content.name: Lilian Voss
content.flavor: She doesn't feel pity, or remorse, or fear. And she absolutely will not stop... ever, until all necromancers are dead.
content.text: Battlecry: Replace spells in your hand with random spells (from your opponent's class).

content.name: Meat Wagon
content.flavor: Necromancers call it 'Meals on Wheels.'
content.text: Deathrattle: Summon a minion from your deck with less Attack than this minion.

content.name: Chillblade Champion
content.flavor: It slices, it dices, it vaporizes! The Chillblade will make a Champion out of even the lowliest gnome.
content.text: Charge Lifesteal

content.name: Simulacrum
content.flavor: It's like déjà vu, times two.
content.text: Copy the lowest Cost minion in your hand.

content.name: Abominable Bowman
content.flavor: Frosty the Bowman... was an angry hateful soul... with a fresh hewn bow and a missing nose...
content.text: Deathrattle: Summon a random friendly Beast that died this game.

content.name: Valeera the Hollow
content.flavor: 'Run away. Hide in your precious keeps, behind your walls and your bodyguards. Night always falls, and shadows will fill your hallowed halls. One day, one of those shadows will be me.'
content.text: Battlecry: Gain Stealth until your next turn.

content.name: Deathstalker Rexxar
content.flavor: 'You were too slow, old friend. The hunt began long ago. And now... it will never end.'
content.text: Battlecry: Deal 2 damage to all enemy minions.

content.name: Uther of the Ebon Blade
content.flavor: 'Step forward. Confess! Once I was a mere servant of the Light. Now I alone stand in judgement.'
content.text: Battlecry: Equip a 5/3 Lifesteal weapon.

content.name: Shadowreaper Anduin
content.flavor: 'I will tell you what Velen never taught me. Whosoever stands before the Light… inevitably casts a shadow.'
content.text: Battlecry: Destroy all minions with 5 or more Attack.

content.name: Bloodreaver Gul'dan
content.flavor: 'Still you refuse to bend your knee? None can escape death, you old fool. And in death… all will serve me…'
content.text: Battlecry: Summon all friendly Demons that died this game.

content.name: Malfurion the Pestilent
content.flavor: 'Cenarius once taught me about the precarious balance between life and death. I have come to understand: there IS no balance. Death always wins.'
content.text: Choose One - Summon 2 Poisonous Spiders; or 2 Scarabs with Taunt.

content.name: Frost Lich Jaina
content.flavor: 'Arthas was a spoiled child, playing with toys he could neither control nor understand. Come into the cold. I will show you the true power of the Frozen Throne.'
content.text: Battlecry: Summon a 3/6 Water Elemental. Your Elementals have Lifesteal this game.

content.name: Scourgelord Garrosh
content.flavor: 'You dare to challenge me? Come! Draw your last breath - and then, you are mine.'
content.text: Battlecry: Equip a 4/3 Shadowmourne that also damages adjacent minions.

content.name: Hadronox
content.flavor: The viziers of Azjol-Nerub released Hadronox as a last-ditch effort to hold back the Lich King. They did so by VERY carefully scooping him up in a LARGE newspaper and releasing him.
content.text: Deathrattle: Summon your Taunt minions that died this game.

content.name: Breath of Sindragosa
content.flavor: Is it cold in here or is it just Sindragosa?
content.text: Deal $2 damage to a random enemy minion and Freeze it.

content.name: Bring It On!

content.text: Taunt Battlecry: Summon a random 2-Cost minion for your opponent.

content.name: Fungal Enchanter
content.flavor: Qualifications: Born with pointy hat.
content.text: Battlecry: Restore 2 Health to all friendly characters.

content.name: Rummaging Kobold
content.flavor: 'Broken longsword is brand new shortsword.' - Kobold Proverb
content.text: Battlecry: Return one of your destroyed weapons to your hand.

content.name: Twig of the World Tree
content.flavor: For druids who want to branch out.
content.text: Deathrattle: Gain 10 Mana Crystals.

content.name: Shrieking Shroom
content.flavor: Auditioning for the next Fungal Idol.
content.text: At the end of your turn, summon a random 1-Cost minion.

content.name: Benevolent Djinn
content.flavor: Wish #1: funnel cakes. Wish #2: funnel cakes. Wish #3: FUNNEL CAKES.
content.text: At the end of your turn, restore 3 Health to your hero.

content.name: Duskbreaker
content.flavor: Waking up at the break of dusk is just not as impressive.
content.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, deal 3 damage to all other minions.

content.name: Kobold Illusionist
content.flavor: He can make ANYTHING look like a candle.
content.text: Deathrattle: Summon a 1/1 copy of a minion from your hand.

content.name: Plated Beetle
content.flavor: 'Ok, your party has defeated the beetle.' 'I put it on my head.' 'What?' 'I put it on my head. Like a hat.'
content.text: Deathrattle: Gain 3 Armor.

content.name: Grand Archivist
content.flavor: Qualifications: Found pointy hat.
content.text: At the end of your turn, cast a spell from your deck (targets chosen randomly).

content.name: Rin, the First Disciple
content.flavor: Signed and sealed, she delivers oblivion.
content.text: Taunt Deathrattle: Add 'The First Seal' to your hand.

content.name: Cataclysm
content.flavor: RUN FROM SKY CANDLES! THEY BURN! RUN!
content.text: Destroy all minions. Discard your hand.

content.name: Skull of the Man'ari
content.flavor: Don't trust the skull.
content.text: At the start of your turn, summon a Demon from your hand.

content.name: Val'anyr
content.flavor: Recently unearthed in one of the deepest kobold caves. Traded for a large candle.
content.text: Deathrattle: Give a minion in your hand +4/+2. When it dies, reequip this.

content.name: Lesser Onyx Spellstone
content.collectionText: Destroy 1 random enemy minion. (Play 3 Deathrattle cards to upgrade.)
content.flavor: The trolls of old embraced the gift A jewel of black for daggers swift No party lasts who finds the stone Those wielding it soon stand alone.
content.text: Destroy 1 random enemy minion. @(Play 3 Deathrattle cards to upgrade.)

content.name: Unstable Evolution
content.flavor: They grow up so fast.
content.text: Transform a friendly minion into one that costs (1) more. Repeatable this turn.

content.name: The Runespear
content.flavor: When asked what the runes do, the tauren smith smiled: 'A little of this, a little of that...'
content.text: After your hero attacks, Discover a spell and cast it with random targets.

content.name: Lesser Diamond Spellstone
content.collectionText: Resurrect 2 different friendly minions. (Cast 4 spells to upgrade.)
content.flavor: A diamond, white, this stone the eighth A precious jewel for those of faith A whispered prayer restores the lost But none among them know the cost.
content.text: Resurrect 2 different friendly minions. @(Cast 4 spells to upgrade.)

content.name: Kathrena Winterwisp
content.flavor: She’s not one of those treehugger elves – but she does like the occasional cuddle.
content.text: Battlecry and Deathrattle: Recruit a Beast.

content.name: Zola the Gorgon
content.flavor: Her name seems a bit cheesy.
content.text: Battlecry: Choose a friendly minion. Add a Golden copy of it to your hand.

content.name: Murmuring Elemental
content.flavor: Déjà Dude.
content.text: Battlecry: Your next Battlecry this turn triggers twice.

content.name: Windshear Stormcaller
content.flavor: Don't ever doubt Al'Akir's love for basic totems.
content.text: Battlecry: If you control all 4 basic Totems, summon Al'Akir the Windlord.

content.name: Geosculptor Yip
content.flavor: Once crafted a gauntlet out of earwax and pure ambition.
content.text: At the end of your turn, summon a random minion with Cost equal to your Armor (up to 10).

content.name: Seeping Oozeling
content.flavor: Uh, you might want to get that looked at.
content.text: Battlecry: Gain the Deathrattle of a random minion in your deck.

content.name: Master Oakheart
content.flavor: His adventuring party consists of Goldshire Footman, Frostwolf Grunt and Hadronox.
content.text: Battlecry: Recruit a 1, 2, and 3-Attack minion.

content.name: Crushing Walls
content.flavor: 'It could be worse!' 'It's worse.'
content.text: Destroy your opponent's left and right-most minions.

content.name: The Darkness
content.flavor: I would rather light a single candle than curse the darkness. But I'm willing to do both.
content.text: Starts dormant. Battlecry: Shuffle 3 Candles into the enemy deck. When drawn, this awakens.

content.name: Twilight Acolyte
content.flavor: The dragons mostly keep him around as a snack.
content.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, swap this minion's Attack with another minion's.

content.name: Void Ripper
content.flavor: You had to put the portable hole inside the bag of holding, didn't you?!
content.text: Battlecry: Swap the Attack and Health of all other minions.

content.name: Gilded Gargoyle
content.flavor: You hear a coin rattling inside the slotted gargoyle...What could it mean?
content.text: Deathrattle: Add a Coin to your hand.

content.name: Dragoncaller Alanna
content.flavor: Her secret is using a gentle voice and carrying a baggie of hotdogs.
content.text: Battlecry: Summon a 5/5 Dragon for each spell you cast this game that costs (5) or more.

content.name: Leyline Manipulator
content.flavor: The shortest distance between two points is a leyline.
content.text: Battlecry: If you're holding any cards that didn't start in your deck, reduce their Cost by (2).

content.name: Temporus
content.flavor: Follows adventurers, seeking the ultimate time magic: the ability to reload.
content.text: Battlecry: Your opponent takes two turns. Then you take two turns.

content.name: Spiteful Summoner
content.flavor: Sometimes she'll summon a Doomsayer. Out of spite.
content.text: Battlecry: Reveal a spell from your deck. Summon  a random minion with the same Cost.

content.name: Dragonhatcher
content.flavor: Which came first?  The dragon or the dragonhatcher?
content.text: At the end of your turn, Recruit a Dragon.

content.name: King Togwaggle
content.flavor: Management of the Kobold Empire requires a careful balance between a lack of social services and fiscal irresponsibility.
content.text: Battlecry: Swap decks with your opponent. Give them a Ransom spell to swap back.

content.name: Kingsbane
content.flavor: But it has a soft spot for emperors.
content.text: Deathrattle: Shuffle this into your deck. It keeps any enchantments.

content.name: Sacrificial Pact
content.flavor: This is the reason that Demons never really become friends with Warlocks.
content.howToEarn: Unlocked at Level 8.
content.howToEarnGolden: Unlocked at Level 15.
content.text: Destroy a Demon. Restore #5 Health to your hero.

content.name: Vanish
content.howToEarn: Unlocked at Level 8.
content.howToEarnGolden: Unlocked at Level 23.
content.text: Return all minions to their owner's hand.

content.name: Kidnapper
content.flavor: He just wants people to see his vacation photos.
content.text: Combo: Return a minion to its owner's hand.

content.name: Starfall
content.flavor: Is the sky falling?  Yes.  Yes it is.
content.text: Choose One - Deal $5 damage to a minion; or $2 damage to all enemy minions.

content.name: Ancient of Lore
content.flavor: Go ahead, carve your initials in him.
content.text: Choose One - Draw a card; or Restore 5 Health.

content.name: Al'Akir the Windlord
content.flavor: He is the weakest of the four Elemental Lords.  And the other three don't let him forget it.
content.text: Charge, Divine Shield, Taunt, Windfury

content.name: Kor'kron Elite
content.flavor: The Kor'kron are the elite forces of Garrosh Hellscream. Let's just say you don't want to run into these guys while wearing a blue tabard.
content.howToEarn: Unlocked at Level 4.
content.howToEarnGolden: Unlocked at Level 44.
content.text: Charge

content.name: Mana Wyrm
content.flavor: These wyrms feed on arcane energies, and while they are generally considered a nuisance rather than a real threat, you really shouldn't leave them alone with a bucket of mana.
content.text: Whenever you cast a spell, gain +1 Attack.

content.name: Master of Disguise
content.flavor: She's actually a male tauren.  People don't call him 'Master of Disguise' for nothing.
content.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly minion Stealth until your next turn.

content.name: Captain's Parrot
content.flavor: Pirates and Parrots go together like Virmen and Carrots.
content.howToEarn: Unlocked when you have all the Pirates from the Classic Set.
content.howToEarnGolden: Unlocked when you have all the Golden Pirates from the Expert Set.
content.text: Battlecry: Draw a Pirate from your deck.

content.name: Hungry Crab
content.flavor: Murloc.  It's what's for dinner.
content.text: Battlecry: Destroy a Murloc and gain +2/+2.

content.name: Bloodsail Raider
content.flavor: 'I only plunder on days that end in 'y'.'
content.text: Battlecry: Gain Attack equal to the Attack of your weapon.

content.name: Knife Juggler
content.flavor: Ambitious Knife Jugglers sometimes graduate to Bomb Jugglers.    They never last long enough to make it onto a card though.
content.text: After you summon a minion, deal 1 damage to a random enemy.

content.name: Wild Pyromancer
content.flavor: BOOM BABY BOOM!  BAD IS GOOD!  DOWN WITH GOVERNMENT!
content.text: After you cast a spell, deal 1 damage to ALL minions.

content.name: Doomsayer
content.flavor: He's almost been right so many times. He was sure it was coming during the Cataclysm.
content.text: At the start of your turn, destroy ALL minions.

content.name: Dread Corsair
content.flavor: 'Yarrrr' is a pirate word that means 'Greetings, milord.'
content.text: Taunt Costs (1) less per Attack of your weapon.

content.name: Faerie Dragon
content.flavor: Adorable.  Immune to Magic.  Doesn't pee on the rug.  The perfect pet!
content.text: Can't be targeted by spells or Hero Powers.

content.name: Captain Greenskin
content.flavor: He was this close to piloting a massive juggernaut into Stormwind Harbor. If it weren't for those pesky kids!
content.text: Battlecry: Give your weapon +1/+1.

content.name: Bloodsail Corsair
content.flavor: Every pirate uses the same four digits to access Automated Gold Dispensers.  It's called the 'Pirate's Code'.
content.text: Battlecry: Remove 1 Durability from your opponent's weapon.

content.name: Violet Teacher
content.flavor: If you don't pay attention, you may be turned into a pig.  And then you get your name on the board.
content.text: Whenever you cast a spell, summon a 1/1 Violet Apprentice.

content.name: Southsea Captain
content.flavor: When he saves enough plunder, he's going to commission an enormous captain's hat.  He has hat envy.
content.text: Your other Pirates have +1/+1.

content.name: Millhouse Manastorm
content.flavor: 'I'm gonna light you up, sweetcheeks!'
content.text: Battlecry: Enemy spells cost (0) next turn.

content.name: Deathwing
content.flavor: Once a noble dragon known as Neltharion, Deathwing lost his mind and shattered Azeroth before finally being defeated.  Daddy issues?
content.text: Battlecry: Destroy all other minions and discard your hand.

content.name: Animal Companion
content.flavor: You could summon Misha, Leokk, or Huffer!  Huffer is more trouble than he's worth.
content.howToEarn: Unlocked at Level 2.
content.howToEarnGolden: Unlocked at Level 45.
content.text: Summon a random Beast Companion.

content.name: Commanding Shout
content.flavor: 'Shout! Shout! Let it all out!' - Advice to warriors-in-training
content.text: Your minions can't be reduced below 1 Health this turn. Draw a card.

content.name: Master Swordsmith
content.flavor: He's currently trying to craft a 'flail-axe', but all the other swordsmiths say it can't be done.
content.text: At the end of your turn, give another random friendly minion +1 Attack.

content.name: Gruul
content.flavor: He's Gruul 'the Dragonkiller'.  He just wanted to cuddle them… he never meant to…
content.text: At the end of each turn, gain +1/+1 .

content.name: Hogger
content.flavor: Hogger is super powerful. If you kill him, it's because he let you.
content.text: At the end of your turn, summon a 2/2 Gnoll with Taunt.

content.name: Stampeding Kodo
content.flavor: This Kodo is so big that he can stampede by himself.
content.text: Battlecry: Destroy a random enemy minion with 2 or less Attack.

content.name: Vilefin Inquisitor
content.flavor: Nobody expects the Vilefin Inquisition!
content.text: Battlecry: Your Hero Power becomes 'Summon a   1/1 Murloc.'

content.name: Primal Fusion
content.flavor: Golce and Dabbana have a new line of Earth Totems available at vendors everywhere this holiday season.
content.text: Give a minion +1/+1 for each of your Totems.

content.name: Flamewreathed Faceless
content.flavor: He's on fire! Boomshakalaka!
content.text: Overload: (2)

content.name: Eternal Sentinel
content.flavor: Just try to avoid eye contact.
content.text: Battlecry: Unlock your Overloaded Mana Crystals.

content.name: Evolve
content.flavor: So you say you want an evolution. Well, you know. We all want to change the board.
content.text: Transform your minions into random minions that cost (1) more.

content.name: Thing from Below
content.flavor: Just can't resist the opportunity to hang around with a bunch of totems.
content.text: Taunt Costs (1) less for each Totem you've summoned this game.

content.name: Hammer of Twilight
content.flavor: Stop! It's Twilight Hammer time.
content.text: Deathrattle: Summon a 4/2 Elemental.

content.name: Tentacles for Arms
content.flavor: That's right. Garrosh just slapped you to death with a tentacle.
content.text: Deathrattle: Return this to your hand.

content.name: Silithid Swarmer
content.flavor: If your hero doesn't attack, it's just 'Silithid Loner'.
content.text: Can only attack if your hero attacked this turn.

content.name: Y'Shaarj, Rage Unbound
content.flavor: When he's working out, he binds all that rage back into a ponytail.
content.text: At the end of your turn, put a minion from your deck into the battlefield.

content.name: Fandral Staghelm
content.flavor: Always manages to mention 'Back when I was creating the World Tree…' in EVERY conversation. Sheesh! Enough already.
content.text: Your Choose One cards and powers have both effects combined.

content.name: Infest
content.flavor: The best part is the look on their face when you jump out of the cake! Err… corpse.
content.text: Give your minions 'Deathrattle: Add a random Beast to your hand.'

content.name: Feral Rage
content.flavor: Let's be honest. One option is a lot ragier than the other.
content.text: Choose One - Give your hero +4 Attack this turn; or Gain 8 Armor.

content.name: Mark of Y'Shaarj
content.flavor: Y'Shaarj had three sons: Mark, Theodore, and Chris.
content.text: Give a minion +2/+2. If it's a Beast, draw a card.

content.name: Forbidden Ancient
content.flavor: This Ancient was banned from the local tavern after tucking a 'Dr. Boom' up its sleeve.
content.text: Battlecry: Spend all your Mana. Gain +1/+1 for each mana spent.

content.name: On the Hunt
content.flavor: The mastiff giggles if you don't hit any ducks.
content.text: Deal $1 damage. Summon a 1/1 Mastiff.

content.name: Bladed Cultist
content.flavor: He has a poor understanding of the law of diminishing returns.
content.text: Combo: Gain +1/+1.

content.name: Journey Below
content.flavor: Don't stop believing there's something below.
content.text: Discover a Deathrattle card.

content.name: Thistle Tea
content.flavor: Aren't Thistles prickly?  Why would you drink them? I don't get Rogues.
content.text: Draw a card. Add 2 extra copies of it to your hand.

content.name: Xaril, Poisoned Mind
content.flavor: It's basically your own fault if you go around drinking weird green potions handed out by creepy mantid dudes.
content.text: Battlecry and Deathrattle: Add a random Toxin card to your hand.

content.name: Shatter
content.flavor: What's cooler than being cool?
content.text: Destroy a Frozen minion.

content.name: Evolved Kobold
content.flavor: You no take tentacle!
content.text: Spell Damage +2

content.name: Twilight Flamecaller
content.flavor: Make sure you summon a Twilight Marshmallowcaller too! Mmmm Mmm Mmm!!
content.text: Battlecry: Deal 1 damage to all enemy minions.

content.name: Demented Frostcaller
content.flavor: He prefers that you refer to him by his nickname: 'Frostwaker.'
content.text: After you cast a spell, Freeze a random enemy.

content.name: Forbidden Flame
content.flavor: WARNING: This flame is not to be used unless you are a licensed acolyte of the Old Gods.
content.text: Spend all your Mana. Deal that much damage to a minion.

content.name: Servant of Yogg-Saron
content.flavor: Yogg-Saron always likes to complain about how he has too many servants and there are too many mouths to feed.
content.text: Battlecry: Cast a random spell that costs (5) or less (targets chosen randomly).

content.name: Cabalist's Tome
content.flavor: What's in there? I bet it's cookie recipes!
content.text: Add 3 random Mage spells to your hand.

content.name: Power Word: Tentacles
content.flavor: Because you're wrapped in a protective layer of… tentacles?
content.text: Give a minion +2/+6.

content.name: Twilight Darkmender
content.flavor: First she separates them from the lights, washes them in cold water, and hang-dries.
content.text: Battlecry: If your C'Thun  has at least 10 Attack, restore 10 Health to your hero.

content.name: Shadow Word: Horror
content.flavor: It's more succinct than 'Shadow Word: Suck Into Vortex.'
content.text: Destroy all minions with 2 or less Attack.

content.name: Forbidden Shaping
content.flavor: But the minion arrives covered in goo.
content.text: Spend all your Mana. Summon a random minion that costs that much.

content.name: Darkspeaker
content.flavor: People often think that Darkspeaker is the arch nemesis of Lightspeaker, but that title actually belongs to Heavyspeaker.
content.text: Battlecry: Swap stats with a friendly minion.

content.name: Embrace the Shadow
content.flavor: For when your Auchenai Soulpriests call in sick.
content.text: This turn, your healing effects deal damage instead.

content.name: Darkshire Librarian
content.flavor: Do NOT be late with your overdue fines.
content.text: Battlecry: Discard a random card. Deathrattle: Draw a card.

content.name: Darkshire Councilman
content.flavor: Democracy in action!
content.text: After you summon a minion,  gain +1 Attack.

content.name: Forbidden Ritual
content.flavor: Actually, C'Thun gives his full support for this ritual.
content.text: Spend all your Mana. Summon that many 1/1 Tentacles.

content.name: Spreading Madness
content.flavor: Most citizens of Darkshire wear those surgical masks to prevent spreading Madness to tourists.
content.text: Deal $9 damage randomly split among ALL characters.

content.name: Renounce Darkness
content.flavor: SEE YA DARKNESS!
content.text: Replace your Hero Power and Warlock cards with another class's. The cards cost (1) less.

content.name: Anomalus
content.flavor: That's short for 'Anomnomnomnomalus'.
content.text: Deathrattle: Deal 8 damage to all minions.

content.name: Cho'gall
content.flavor: Even after all this time, Gul'dan still makes Cho'gall go get donuts and coffee.
content.text: Battlecry: The next spell you cast this turn costs Health instead of Mana.

content.name: Mukla, Tyrant of the Vale
content.flavor: Pro tip: DO NOT BOGART THE BANANAS.
content.text: Battlecry: Add 2 Bananas to your hand.

content.name: Shifter Zerus
content.flavor: It's like being able to play with THREE angry chickens!
content.text: Each turn this is in your hand, transform it into a random minion.

content.name: Twin Emperor Vek'lor
content.flavor: Do they make decisions based on age? 'I'm two minutes older therefore we burn this village.'
content.text: Taunt Battlecry: If your C'Thun has at least 10 Attack, summon another Emperor.

content.name: N'Zoth, the Corruptor
content.flavor: Has not been able to get 'Under the Sea' out of his head for like FIVE THOUSAND YEARS.
content.text: Battlecry: Summon your Deathrattle minions that died this game.

content.name: Yogg-Saron, Hope's End
content.flavor: I spell your doom... Y-O-U-R D-O-O-M!
content.text: Battlecry: Cast a random spell for each spell you've cast this game (targets chosen randomly).

content.name: Nerubian Prophet
content.flavor: It’s a self-reducing prophecy.
content.text: At the start of your turn, reduce this card's Cost by (1).

content.name: Faceless Behemoth
content.flavor: Rejected names: Forty-Foot Faceless, Big ol' No-face, Huge Creature Sans Face, Teddy.

content.name: Eldritch Horror
content.flavor: Often wonders what path his life might have taken if he wasn't named, you know, 'Eldritch Horror'.

content.name: Psych-o-Tron
content.flavor: 'Annoyinger-o-Tron' was just too unwieldy. And accurate.
content.text: Taunt Divine Shield

content.name: Corrupted Healbot
content.flavor: Not so much 'corrupted' as 'has terrible aim'.
content.text: Deathrattle: Restore 8 Health to the enemy hero.

content.name: Ravaging Ghoul
content.flavor: But goes by 'Ravishing Ghoul' when he hits the club.
content.text: Battlecry: Deal 1 damage to all other minions.

content.name: Aberrant Berserker
content.flavor: I berserk, therefore I am.
content.text: Enrage: +2 Attack.

content.name: Tentacle of N'Zoth
content.flavor: Because EVERYDAY is the Day of the Tentacle of N'zoth.
content.text: Deathrattle: Deal 1 damage to all minions.

content.name: Grotesque Dragonhawk
content.flavor: They say that 'grotesque is in the eye of the beholder,' but that's just because they've never seen a Grotesque Dragonhawk. Yikes!
content.text: Windfury

content.name: Bog Creeper
content.flavor: He's tried other things, but bog sidling, bog ambling, and bog trundling just aren't as effective as bog creeping.
content.text: Taunt

content.name: Bilefin Tidehunter
content.flavor: Bile actually makes for surprisingly sturdy fins.
content.text: Battlecry: Summon a 1/1 Ooze with Taunt.

content.name: Zealous Initiate
content.flavor: Ok, Initiate. You need to settle down and do your job. In this case, that means die so someone else can get a minor buff.
content.text: Deathrattle: Give a random friendly minion +1/+1.

content.name: Corrupted Seer
content.flavor: For seers, it's very handy to have your crystal ball hanging right in front of your face.
content.text: Battlecry: Deal 2 damage to all non-Murloc minions.

content.name: Disciple of C'Thun
content.flavor: C’Thun’s recruiting pitch involves cookies, which is why it’s the most popular Old God.
content.text: Battlecry: Deal 2 damage. Give your C'Thun +2/+2 (wherever it is).

content.name: Blood of The Ancient One
content.flavor: Add two cups of Blood of the Ancient One to one cup of lemon juice. Add just a dash of sugar and stir. Delicious!
content.text: If you control two of these at the end of your turn, merge them into 'The Ancient One'.

content.name: Faceless Shambler
content.flavor: 'What is that thing?!' 'I'm not sure, but it seems to be sort of Ysera shaped.'
content.text: Taunt Battlecry: Copy a friendly minion's Attack and Health.

content.name: Shadow Strike
content.flavor: It's like a backstab, only from the front. And with two more stabs.
content.text: Deal $5 damage to an undamaged character.

content.name: Fiery Bat
content.flavor: He'll always be our first.
content.text: Deathrattle: Deal 1 damage to a random enemy.

content.name: Klaxxi Amber-Weaver
content.flavor: Amberweaving is a specialty course at the local trade school.
content.text: Battlecry: If your C'Thun has at least 10 Attack, gain +5 Health.

content.name: Wisps of the Old Gods
content.flavor: They're just normal wisps, actually. The 'Of the Old Gods' bit is just marketing.
content.text: Choose One - Summon seven 1/1 Wisps; or Give your minions +2/+2.

content.name: Forbidden Healing
content.flavor: No one's quite sure why it's forbidden. And yes, that should make you nervous.
content.text: Spend all your Mana. Restore twice that much Health.

content.name: Validated Doomsayer
content.flavor: Really feels good about himself and is in a much better place now. But… he sure does miss piloting those shredders.
content.text: At the start of your turn, set this minion's Attack to 7.

content.name: Mire Keeper
content.flavor: 'Hey.... Is that Mire for sale?'  'No.  I'm keeping it.'
content.text: Choose One - Summon a 2/2 Slime; or Gain an empty Mana Crystal.

content.name: Stormcrack
content.flavor: WARNING: DO NOT TOUCH THE PURPLE BALL OF LIGHTNING
content.text: Deal $4 damage to a minion. Overload: (1)

content.name: Faceless Summoner
content.flavor: They never get the recognition they deserve.
content.text: Battlecry: Summon a random 3-Cost minion.

content.name: Hallazeal the Ascended
content.flavor: Hallazeals all your dallazamage.
content.text: Whenever your spells deal damage, restore that much Health to your hero.

content.name: Call of the Wild
content.flavor: 'Hello. Misha, Leokk and Huffer aren't here right now, but if you leave a message we'll get back to you right away.' BEEP.
content.text: Summon all three Animal Companions.

content.name: Infested Wolf
content.flavor: A little flea powder will fix that right up.
content.text: Deathrattle: Summon two 1/1 Spiders.

content.name: Bloodhoof Brave
content.flavor: He thought the set was called 'Flippers of the Old Cods' and hungrily volunteered to be in it.  He is definitely going to get his hearing checked.
content.text: Taunt Enrage: +3 Attack.

content.name: Malkorok
content.flavor: Garrosh's best buddy. It's true. Look it up.
content.text: Battlecry: Equip a random weapon.

content.name: Selfless Hero
content.flavor: 'Don't worry about me… I'll just be here... under these tentacles.'
content.text: Deathrattle: Give a random friendly minion Divine Shield.

content.name: Rallying Blade
content.flavor: As far as blades go, this one is pretty great in the motivation department.
content.text: Battlecry: Give +1/+1 to your minions with Divine Shield.

content.name: Divine Strength

content.name: Hemet, Jungle Hunter

content.text: Battlecry: Destroy all cards in your deck that cost (3) or less.

content.name: The Voraxx
content.flavor: I am the Voraxx.  I speak for the weeds.
content.text: After you cast a spell on this minion, summon a 1/1 Plant and cast another copy on it.

content.name: Humongous Razorleaf
content.flavor: Loves goblins.  In a light cream sauce.
content.text: Can't attack.

content.name: Igneous Elemental
content.flavor: We wanted to name him 'Ingenious Elemental', but he just wasn't that bright.
content.text: Deathrattle: Add two 1/2 Elementals to your hand.

content.name: Shimmering Tempest
content.flavor: HATES being summoned for Kirin Tor party lighting.
content.text: Deathrattle: Add a random Mage spell to your hand.

content.name: Blazecaller
content.flavor: For when a flamecaller just won't do.
content.text: Battlecry: If you played an Elemental last turn, deal 5 damage.

content.name: Primordial Drake
content.flavor: Before he became a rap artist.
content.text: Taunt Battlecry: Deal 2 damage to all other minions.

content.name: Elise the Trailblazer
content.flavor: Reno taught her that blazing her own trail is a lot more fun than following someone else's map.
content.text: Battlecry: Shuffle a sealed Un'Goro pack into your deck.

content.name: Tyrantus
content.flavor: Millennia of evolutionary pressures turned his species into the Faerie Dragons we know today.
content.text: Can't be targeted by spells or Hero Powers.

content.name: Free From Amber
content.flavor: Bingo! Minion DNA!
content.text: Discover a minion that costs (8) or more. Summon it.

content.name: Hallucination
content.flavor: It's the good kind of hallucination.
content.text: Discover a card from your opponent's class.

content.name: Spiritsinger Umbra
content.flavor: She sees the fate of anyone she meets, but it's always the same: dinosaur attack.
content.text: After you summon a minion, trigger its Deathrattle effect.

content.name: Ozruk
content.flavor: Between you and me, Ozruk is a bit obsessed with his body.
content.text: Taunt Battlecry: Gain +5 Health for each Elemental you played last turn.

content.name: Grievous Bite
content.flavor: Ooh.  I'll have a bite of this, and of this, and of this...
content.text: Deal $2 damage to a minion and $1 damage to adjacent ones.

content.name: Jeweled Macaw
content.flavor: It’s not LITERALLY jeweled. The goblins were terribly disappointed.
content.text: Battlecry: Add a random Beast to your hand.

content.name: Tol'vir Warden
content.flavor: Ferocious in combat… and even more terrifying in pet battles.
content.text: Battlecry: Draw two 1-Cost minions from your deck.

content.name: Raptor Hatchling
content.flavor: They’re just baby teeth. Lots and lots of baby teeth.
content.text: Deathrattle: Shuffle a 4/3 Raptor into your deck.

content.name: Crackling Razormaw
content.flavor: Wasn't clever enough to go AROUND the electric fence.
content.text: Battlecry: Adapt a friendly Beast.

content.name: Stampede
content.flavor: Many hunters long for the pitter-patter of enormous feet.
content.text: Each time you play a Beast this turn, add a random Beast to your hand.

content.name: Dinomancy
content.flavor: Anyone can dinomance. Just put your lips together and RAAWWWAARGGGH.
content.text: Your Hero Power becomes 'Give a Beast +2/+2.'

content.name: Swamp King Dred
content.flavor: Swamp King Dred, more like Swamp King Dead, amiright?
content.text: After your opponent plays a minion, attack it.

content.name: The Marsh Queen
content.flavor: Question: What's scarier, one giant angry dinosaur or 15 smaller vicious ones? Answer: AHHHHHHH THEY FOUND MEEEEEE
content.text: Quest: Play seven 1-Cost minions. Reward: Queen Carnassa.

content.name: Explore Un'Goro
content.flavor: It turns out cards DO grow on trees!
content.text: Replace your deck with copies of 'Discover a card.'

content.name: Iron Hide
content.flavor: Week 6. I remain covered head to toe with scales. They do not yet realize that I am not a dinosaur.
content.text: Gain 5 Armor.

content.name: Ornery Direhorn
content.flavor: 'It's an herbivore.  How dangerous can it be?'  - Famous last words
content.text: Taunt Battlecry: Adapt.

content.name: Cornered Sentry
content.flavor: The Draenei are seriously considering cancelling 'Bring Your Murderous Pet to Work Day.'
content.text: Taunt. Battlecry: Summon three 1/1 Raptors for your opponent.

content.name: Sudden Genesis
content.flavor: Being hurt can make you another person.
content.text: Summon copies of your damaged minions.

content.name: Tar Creeper
content.flavor: If you won't come to the tar pits, we'll bring them to you!
content.text: Taunt Has +2 Attack during your opponent's turn.

content.name: Molten Blade
content.flavor: It’s a sword! It’s a knife! It’s a swizzle-stick!
content.text: Each turn this is in your hand, transform it into a new weapon.

content.name: King Mosh
content.flavor: He's a terror at concerts.
content.text: Battlecry: Destroy all damaged minions.

content.name: Fire Plume's Heart
content.flavor: Why does an active volcano need to be defended? To save its ash.
content.text: Quest: Play 7 Taunt minions. Reward: Sulfuras.

content.name: Primalfin Lookout
content.flavor: Lookout is a self-appointed title that's mostly an excuse to beat things up.
content.text: Battlecry: If you control another Murloc, Discover a Murloc.

content.name: Hot Spring Guardian
content.flavor: NONE SHALL PASS until at least an hour after eating.
content.text: Taunt Battlecry: Restore 3 Health.

content.name: Awaken the Makers
content.flavor: They keep hitting the Snooze button.
content.text: Quest: Summon 7 Deathrattle minions. Reward: Amara, Warden of Hope.

content.name: Primordial Glyph
content.flavor: It's the Ancient Tol'vir symbol for 'Whoops!'
content.text: Discover a spell. Reduce its Cost by (2).

content.name: Unite the Murlocs
content.flavor: Form feet and legs!  Form arms and body!  Oh.  Sorry.  I was thinking about Mechafin.
content.text: Quest: Summon 10 Murlocs. Reward: Megafin.

content.name: Gluttonous Ooze
content.flavor: Three time winner of the Un'Goro weapon eating contest.
content.text: Battlecry: Destroy your opponent's weapon and gain Armor equal to its Attack.

content.name: Molten Reflection
content.flavor: Dang, I'm looking pretty hot!
content.text: Choose a friendly minion. Summon a copy of it.

content.name: Vinecleaver
content.flavor: George and Karl!  Thank the Light we found you!
content.text: After your hero attacks, summon two 1/1 Silver Hand Recruits.

content.name: Spikeridged Steed
content.flavor: What beats cavalry? Dinosaur cavalry.
content.text: Give a minion +2/+6 and Taunt. When it dies, summon a Stegodon.

content.name: Primalfin Champion
content.flavor: Sure, he'll return your stuff.  OVER HIS DEAD BODY!
content.text: Deathrattle: Return any spells you cast on this minion to your hand.

content.name: The Last Kaleidosaur
content.flavor: “Impossible!” exclaimed the Silver Hand Recruit, his eyes filled with fear. Uther shook his head, turning the crystal until it caught the light: “Life finds a way.”
content.text: Quest: Cast 6 spells on your minions. Reward: Galvadon.

content.name: Meteor
content.flavor: When you absolutely, positively have to kill all the dinosaurs.
content.text: Deal $15 damage to a minion and $3 damage to adjacent ones.

content.name: Spirit Echo
content.flavor: I guess you can say they’re… “soul survivors.”
content.text: Give your minions 'Deathrattle: Return  this to your hand.'

content.name: Direhorn Hatchling
content.flavor: His mom could beat up your mom.
content.text: Taunt Deathrattle: Shuffle a 6/9 Direhorn with Taunt into your deck.

content.name: Lost in the Jungle
content.flavor: George and Karl were never heard from again.
content.text: Summon two 1/1 Silver Hand Recruits.

content.name: Adaptation
content.flavor: Pray for salvation. If that fails, pray for extra horns or bigger teeth.
content.text: Adapt a friendly minion.

content.name: Lightfused Stegodon
content.flavor: “Come now, Johnston. I think those horns are quite fetching on you.”
content.text: Battlecry: Adapt your Silver Hand Recruits.

content.name: Lyra the Sunshard
content.flavor: Arise, fair sun, and kill my envious foes. They don't have a legendary as beautiful as you.
content.text: Whenever you cast a spell, add a random Priest spell to your hand.

content.flavor: 'I'm sorry, son.  We had to send Old Howler off…to a farm…to play…'
content.name: Rabid Worgen
content.text: Rush

content.flavor: She sells all manner of keys: from A flat to G sharp.
content.name: Arcane Keysmith
content.text: Battlecry: Discover a Secret. Put it into the battlefield.

content.flavor: Does anyone want to play dead!?
content.name: Worgen Abomination
content.text: At the end of your turn, deal 2 damage to all other damaged minions.

content.flavor: Unfortunately, his doctorate is in Murloc Literature.
content.name: Deranged Doctor
content.text: Deathrattle: Restore 8 Health to your hero.

content.flavor: Decorating tip: Unused cauldrons can make a lovely elemental display.
content.name: Cauldron Elemental
content.text: Your other Elementals have +2 Attack.

content.flavor: One head is a morning person. The other head hates morning people.
content.name: Furious Ettin
content.text: Taunt

content.flavor: Birds of a feather Moonfire together.
content.name: Darkmire Moonkin
content.text: Spell Damage +2

content.flavor: The hills have eyes. And teeth. Pretty bad breath, too.
content.name: Mossy Horror
content.text: Battlecry: Destroy all other minions with 2 or less Attack.

content.flavor: He's entirely bonkers. All the best goblins are.
content.name: Mad Hatter
content.text: Battlecry: Randomly toss 3 hats to other minions. Each hat gives +1/+1.

content.flavor: Taste your world's corruption! It tastes like chicken.
content.name: Emeriss
content.text: Battlecry: Double the Attack and Health of all minions in your hand.

content.flavor: Majestic. Ethereal. Still pretty down in the dumps, though.
content.name: Gloom Stag
content.text: Taunt Battlecry: If your deck has only odd-Cost cards, gain +2/+2.

content.flavor: For a healthier option, try Holy Water: Zero.

content.text: Deal $4 damage to a minion. If that kills it, add a copy of it to your hand.

content.flavor: He's everyone you want to be.
content.name: Chameleos
content.text: Each turn this is in your hand, transform it into a card your opponent is holding.

content.flavor: They make wonderful pets if you're not allergic to blood loss.
content.name: Vicious Scalehide

content.flavor: Weirdly, the bells stop ringing after 5.

content.text: Echo Give a minion +1/+2.

content.flavor: Forecast: 'Cloudy with a chance of fireballs.'
content.name: Cinderstorm
content.text: Deal $5 damage randomly split among all enemies.

content.flavor: The upper windows used to be for aiming. Then we thought: 'Hey! MORE cannons!'

content.flavor: Also comes in other colors, but red's in fashion this season.
content.name: Redband Wasp
content.text: Rush Has +3 Attack while damaged.

content.flavor: These elementals, along with feldspar and mica, are often taken for granite.

content.text: Can't attack while damaged.

content.flavor: She's a scythe for sore eyes.
content.name: Druid of the Scythe
content.text: Choose One - Transform into a 4/2 with Rush; or a 2/4 with Taunt.

content.flavor: Everywhelp, get in here!
content.name: Nightscale Matriarch

content.flavor: Like a knitting circle, but less evil.

content.text: Summon four 1/1 Imps.

content.flavor: The cards are always golden on the other side.
content.name: Azalina Soulthief
content.text: Battlecry: Replace your hand with a copy of your opponent's.

content.flavor: After a short paws, she's back to herself again.

content.flavor: Time to squash your opponent.
content.name: Pumpkin Peasant
content.text: Lifesteal Each turn this is in your hand, swap its Attack and Health.

content.flavor: Admittedly, they kind of dropped the ball with Prince Liam.
content.name: Gilnean Royal Guard
content.text: Divine Shield, Rush Each turn this is in your hand, swap its Attack and Health.

content.flavor: When one buke just isn’t enough.

content.text: Enemy spells cost (5) more next turn.

content.flavor: Recruited from the Gilnean opera house.

content.text: Echo Taunt

content.flavor: That Friends and Familiars Plan is really paying off!

content.text: Battlecry: Add two random 1-Cost minions to your hand.

content.flavor: Doom!  Only doom for you!  But pay good tip, maybe less doom.
content.name: Tanglefur Mystic
content.text: Battlecry: Add a random 2-Cost minion to each player's hand.

content.flavor: Curse-bringer, tree-twister, mother of wretched things…Hanzo main.
content.name: Hagatha the Witch
content.text: Battlecry: Deal 3 damage to all minions.

content.flavor: 50% off. Every shot must go!
content.name: Cheap Shot
content.text: Echo  Deal $2 damage to a minion.

content.flavor: Amwitched. Beingwitched. Beenwitched.
content.name: Bewitched Guardian
content.text: Taunt Battlecry: Gain +1 Health  for each card in your hand.

content.flavor: Happily married with two kids. It was love at first bite.
content.name: Duskbat
content.text: Battlecry: If your hero took damage this turn, summon two 1/1 Bats.

content.flavor: One little Mistwraith sitting in a tree. M-I-S-T-I-N-G.

content.text: Whenever you play an Echo card, gain +1/+1.

content.flavor: She simply refuses to ask for directions.

content.flavor: He's on the hunt for Togwaggle's missing rat.

content.text: Rush Battlecry: Destroy a friendly minion and gain its Attack and Health.

content.flavor: Emeriss uses Wing Blast.  It's super effective!
content.name: Wing Blast
content.text: Deal $4 damage to a minion. If a minion died this turn, this costs (1).

content.flavor: They think they're trusted guardians. Dragons think they're convenient snacks.
content.name: Wyrmguard
content.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, gain +1 Attack and Taunt.

content.flavor: Everyone expects an inquisition reference.
content.name: Felsoul Inquisitor

content.flavor: Same turn delivery - guaranteed!

content.flavor: He also goes by 'worg-lock.'

content.flavor: Makes shockingly good unagi.

content.text: Battlecry: If your deck has only even-Cost cards, deal 2 damage.

content.flavor: Is she a frog that became a witch, or a witch that became a frog?

content.flavor: Hard time making ends meet? Hate the League of Explorers? Get a job henching!

content.flavor: Oh look. A Gorehowl.

content.flavor: Wanted on three counts of gnomish possession.

content.text: Deal $2 damage to a friendly character. Discover a Demon.

content.flavor: Maybe we should have called him Ghostly Rusher.
content.name: Ghostly Charger
content.text: Divine Shield Rush

content.flavor: You either die a villain, or live long enough to see yourself become the hero.

content.text: Rush After this attacks and kills a minion, gain +2/+2.

content.flavor: Known throughout the land as the Spooky-nomicon.
content.name: Book of Specters
content.text: Draw 3 cards. Discard any spells drawn.

content.flavor: Just a twist to the left, one quarter turn to the right and … oops! Well, we didn’t need that timeline anyway.
content.name: Toki, Time-Tinker
content.text: Battlecry: Add a random Legendary minion from the past to your hand.

content.flavor: We didn't actually fire the guy who named Dark Wispers.
content.name: Wispering Woods
content.text: Summon a 1/1 Wisp for each card in your hand.

content.flavor: She was an ordinary castaway... until she found that cursed volleyball.
content.name: Cursed Castaway
content.text: Rush Deathrattle: Draw a Combo card from your deck.

content.flavor: A face only a druid could love.
content.name: Swamp Leech
content.text: Lifesteal

content.flavor: 'Oh hi bark.'
content.name: Blackwald Pixie
content.text: Battlecry: Refresh your Hero Power.

content.flavor: It aspires to be a Vilebrood Dancer, but it has eight left feet.
content.name: Vilebrood Skitterer

content.flavor: The itsy bitsy spiders climbed up the village wall. Then came the witch and the spiders ate them all.

content.text: Battlecry: If your hero took damage this turn, gain Lifesteal.

content.flavor: The gates to the Gilnean pet cemetary MUST remain locked at all times.

content.text: Summon a random friendly Beast that died this game.

content.flavor: MISSING: One giant rat. Please return to King Togwaggle.
content.name: Rat Trap
content.text: Secret: After your opponent plays three cards in a turn, summon a 6/6 Rat.

content.flavor: '1 minion… ah, ah, ah! 2 minions… ah, ah, ah! 3 minions… ah, ah, ah!'
content.name: Countess Ashmore
content.text: Battlecry: Draw a Rush, Lifesteal, and Deathrattle card from your deck.

content.flavor: When he was younger, he was the town crybaby.

content.text: Battlecry: Draw a Rush minion from your deck.

content.flavor: The secret is glue.

content.text: Battlecry: Draw an Elemental from your deck.

content.flavor: When regular totem hours won't cut it.
content.name: Totem Cruncher
content.text: Taunt Battlecry: Destroy your Totems. Gain +2/+2 for each destroyed.

content.flavor: She rids villages of annoying pests, like rats and children.

content.text: Battlecry: Draw the lowest Cost minion from your deck.

content.flavor: Or it might not.
content.name: Earthen Might
content.text: Give a minion +2/+2. If it's an Elemental, add a random Elemental to your hand.

content.flavor: Silver’s malleability limits its utility as an edged weapon. On the other hand... SHINY!
content.name: Silver Sword
content.text: After your hero attacks, give your minions +1/+1.

content.flavor: Those who cannot remember their card history are doomed to repeat it.
content.name: Tess Greymane
content.text: Battlecry: Replay every card from another class you've played this game (targets chosen randomly).

content.flavor: The material components for this spell are wool socks and a rug.
content.name: Zap!
content.text: Deal $2 damage to a minion. Overload: (1)

content.flavor: A popular local alternative to bananas.
content.name: Scaleworm
content.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, gain +1 Attack and Rush.

content.flavor: Not all spiders are born poisonous. That's where he comes in.
content.name: Toxmonger
content.text: Whenever you play a 1-Cost minion, give it Poisonous.

content.flavor: 'Shh! You're going to start a howl!'

content.flavor: This wood imp. Stop asking!
content.name: Witchwood Imp
content.text: Stealth Deathrattle: Give a random   friendly minion +2 Health.

content.flavor: 'Aww, I love it! It even kinda looks like me.'
content.name: Voodoo Doll
content.text: Battlecry: Choose a minion. Deathrattle: Destroy the chosen minion.

content.flavor: No use crying over split Festeroot,
content.name: Splitting Festeroot
content.text: Deathrattle: Summon two 2/2 Splitting Saplings.

content.flavor: Summon an unlimited* number of minions!** *Six **Wisps
content.name: Glinda Crowskin
content.text: Minions in your hand have Echo.

content.flavor: The children were puzzled by the scratches covering the insides of their toy-boxes.
content.name: Dollmaster Dorian
content.text: Whenever you draw a minion, summon a 1/1 copy of it.

content.flavor: In a pinch, he'll also settle for Holy Water: Zero.
content.name: Lifedrinker
content.text: Battlecry: Deal 3 damage to the enemy hero. Restore 3 Health to your hero.

content.flavor: You know what they say about people with big hands? Small bears.
content.name: Witchwood Grizzly
content.text: Taunt Battlecry: Lose 1 Health for each card in your opponent's hand.

content.flavor: Listen to the mew-sic of the night.

content.flavor: 'Who are you? Eh, none of my business.'

content.flavor: Fly like an eagle, drop like a rock.

content.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, gain Taunt and Divine Shield.

content.flavor: Have you ever heard the wolf cry to the blue corn moon?

content.flavor: Experts worry that curios are a gateway to face-collecting.

content.text: Whenever you draw a card, gain +1/+1.

content.flavor: Next step: Marshmallow elementals.

content.text: Battlecry: If you played an Elemental last turn, draw a card.

content.flavor: Most mechs are pretty chill, but this one is all wound up.

content.text: Double the damage and healing of your Hero Power.

content.flavor: Empty your pockets, I know you’ve got a Wandering Monster in there!

content.text: Battlecry: Destroy all enemy Secrets.

content.flavor: They’re good dogs, Tess.
content.name: Houndmaster Shaw
content.text: Your other minions have Rush.

content.flavor: It's a lumberjack's axe and that's ok.

content.text: Deathrattle: Give +2/+1 to a random friendly Rush minion.

content.flavor: 'Left, right, left, right, there's none of the enemy left… Right?'

content.text: Echo Deal $1 damage to all minions.

content.flavor: Tree puns arboring.

content.text: After a friendly minion attacks, gain +1 Attack.

content.flavor: We're going to need some bigger tweezers.

content.targetingArrowText: Add a 10/10 copy to your hand.

content.flavor: Taken up an octave, it's highly effective against stained glass golems.

content.flavor: An apple a day keeps the worgen at bay.

content.flavor: As birds of ill omen, these crows often summon Doomsayers.

content.flavor: Warlocks refer to this as a 'balance change.'

content.flavor: Key ingredient in Gilnean applesauce.

content.flavor: So sharp it can cut through a spectral tomato!

content.flavor: “I’ll trade you a Malfurion for an Anduin.”

content.flavor: BoOooOogrglgrlgrlooOoOoo!

content.name: Walnut Sprite

content.flavor: Be all that you can be.

content.text: This is an Elemental, Mech, Demon, Murloc, Dragon, Beast, Pirate and Totem.

content.flavor: You think your job mucks.

content.flavor: She would have gotten away with it, if it weren't for that meddling Drakeslayer.

content.flavor: She’s all fun and games until someone rings that stupid bell.

content.flavor: Wanted: Dead or Undead.

content.flavor: His worgen children call him Archmage AROO-OO-OO-OO-gal.

content.flavor: Ever since Sylvanas killed his son, he's dreamed of getting… even.

content.text: Start of Game: If your deck has only even-Cost cards, your starting Hero Power costs (1).

content.flavor: Like a sloppy joe for vampires.

content.text: At the start of your turn, deal 1 damage to your hero.

content.flavor: 'I have a very particular set of skills. Skills that make me a nightmare for witches like you.'

content.name: Control
content.description: In this archetype you'll most likely want to take the role of the defender and        control the pace of the game. You will want to remove efficiently your opponent's        threats without taking too much damage in the early game and out-value them with        your big threats in the late-game. Some real deck examples are Control        warrior and Control priest.

content.name: Mid-Range
content.description: A mid-range deck usually has as little early game as possible, mainly for defense        purposes. It develops threats in the mid-game and in the late-game tries to end the        game with burst, or by cycling through the deck for new threats, or by developing a        limited number of big threats. Some real deck examples are mid-range Hunter        and mid-range Paladin.

content.name: Aggro
content.description: An aggro archetype favors early board development with high damage minions.        You'll most likely have the board in the early - mid game, so you can take some        efficient trades. Later you'll want to prioritize face damage because you want        to end the game quickly. You kill your opponent with minion damage        (if you still have a board) and most frequently with burst spells / weapons or        charge minions. Some real deck examples are Face Hunter, Aggro Paladin,        Backspace Rogue and some Zoolock Warlock variations.

content.name: Tempo
content.description: A tempo deck emphasizes on using all the available mana every single turn.        You will want to develop early - mid game threats and clear your opponent's        minions with efficient removal mana wise(e.g Hex an Emperor Thaurissan.        You spent 4 mana for their 6 mana card). You finish the game with minion damage,        burn or by developing a big threat. Some real deck examples are Tempo mage and        Tempo Rogue.

content.name: Mill
content.description: In a mill archetype your main focus is to destroy your opponent's cards by overdrawing        them. You' ll most likely deal the final blow by drawing them into fatigue.

content.name: Fatigue - Grinder
content.description: This archetype is the epitome of a control deck. Your goal is to remove all        your opponent's threats efficiently (card advantage wise) and have the last        minion standing. You most often win with fatigue damage after a long game.        Some real deck examples are Fatigue mage, Warrior and Priest.

content.name: Flood
content.description: A flood deck wants to flood the board with cheap and strong minions as soon as possible.        By having the board you can take efficient trades or play synergistic cards in the mid-game.        Some real deck examples could be Zoolock Warlock and Flood mage.
